128606.name: Where No Man Has Gone Before (Version 1.0)
128606.description:
From Introduction:

This is a game about a five year mission, a world where special effects never progressed beyond painted Styrofoam blocks and cheap double-exposures. The 70's were still The Future and Klingons had smooth foreheads. The idea of a Star Trek movie was a laughable proposition and nobody thought twice about planets full of Nazis and space hippies.

Adventures take place in Episodes, over the course of a Season. If you're comfortable with the Shatnerian school of acting, can spontaneously hum snippets of the original soundtrack during appropriate scenes and have no problem with outrageous accents, this is the place for you.

The goal of this game is to create something relatively quick and dirty, simple to set up and fast to run, using the d20 Modern system for accessibility and to allow access to the vast amount of pregenerated d20 content. Hopefully, it strikes a balance between camp and grit: while much of this game is pretty silly, much of it isn't. This is, after all, a television show that brought us both "The City On The Edge Of Forever" and "Spock's Brain."

128607.name: Hole in the Wall
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
128607.description:
From the Cover:

A One-Round D&D Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

Freeholder Marius Lindon has sent notice; you have been chosen to represent the Yeomanry on a mission of diplomacy to the largest Hillman clan in the northern Little Hills. A test has been arranged by this clan to prove the true worth of the Yeomanry as allies. Will you prove yourself worthy, or fail the nation?

128608.name: The Fires of Truth
rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
128608.description:
From the Cover:

A One-Round D&D Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

A series of brutal killings bring terror to the Southern Pass of the Yeomanry. The militia has been dispatched to investigate the problem, but none have returned. Can the characters stop the killings before more lives are lost? An adventure for characters level 3-8.

rpgseries: YEO - Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventures
128609.name: A Friend in Need
128609.description:
A One-Round D&D Living Greyhawk Yeomanry Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The alliance between the Yeomanry League and the Hillman of Clan Cumalh is solidified. When a crisis arises on the northern border, will the alliance hold?

A Yeomanry regional adventure for [character levels] 4 - 10.

128610.name: Castle Story
128610.description:
Castle Story is a creative voxel-based strategy game in which you can build castles one brick at a time using an army of little characters called Bricktrons.

Your goal will be to explore a vast landscape full of mysteries and dangers, and defend your castle against onslaughts of hostile creatures and possibly other players.

The world of Castle Story takes place on flying islands, high above an infinite ocean. The islands are made of voxels, cubes made of various elements, which means you can dig, carve and build anything you can imagine in the landscape. Digging underground to gather resources, stacking bricks on top of each other to build a wall or even tunnelling through a mountain is all possible and even necessary to keep your Bricktrons safe.

Carefully designing your castle not only requires creativity and imagination, but thanks to pathfinding AI and physics simulations, Castle Story has layers of strategy and depth on top of an otherwise free-form sandbox experience.

Source: The Publisher Website.

128611.name: The Shadowrun Supplemental (Issue 12 - 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Places to Go, People to See
128611.description:
From the front cover:

In This Issue:
ShadeTrompers #2 - It’s time for some Legwork!
Berserk - A new sport - Urban Brawl... with character!
New Columns!
Damage Control, Places to Go, People to See, and the return of A Little Learning...
SwiftOne Speaks - SwiftOne gives his take on FASAs recent releases.
And more!
Cover Art by Drea O’Dare

128612.name: The Shadowrun Supplemental (Issue 13 - 2000)
rpgissuearticle: "How Much Did You Say He Weighed?"
Places to Go, People to See
128612.description:
From the front page:

In This Issue:
FASA Closing! - Early thoughts on the closing of FASA
The True Facade - A new feature debuts - shadowcomments from the “real world”
How Much Did You Say He Weighed? - A Third Edition update of this popular article about realistic heights and weights!
SwiftOne Speaks - SwiftOne gives his take on FASAs recent releases, and the closing of FASA
And more!
Cover Art by Drea O’Dare

128613.name: A Month of Sundays
128613.description:
From the front page:

King Cobra #2
A Month of Sundays
A 1-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 3.0 Scenario
by Carl Buehler, Rich Osterhout & Matthew Phillips

Sergeant Sunday has gone missing during a visit to a shadow clinic for “cosmetic surgery and routine maintenance”. Major Black needs her found before her family reunion in 42 hours or her family will start asking questions that the UCAS Special Forces Command (SFC) does not want asked. King Cobra is activated – find Sunday and get her to the reunion on time!

128614.name: And a Child Shall Lead...
128614.description:
From the front page:

And a Child Shall Lead ...
A One-Round Virtual Seattle Tournament Scenario Using Shadowrun II Rules
by Rob Heintz

128615.description:
From the back cover:
This scenario booklet has been written and designed with the wargamer in mind and provides 12 actions from the War with America 1812-1815 as table-top scenarios.

Full color, 84 pages.

No rules are provided -- rather there are 12 rules neutral scenarios from the period.
128615.name: Scenarios for the War of 1812

128616.name: Back Up
128616.description:
From the front page:

Back Up
A One-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
by Stepher W. Gabriel

You are hired to be the unseen back up team to a bodyguard team, and it is imperative that your team is not seen or heard.

128617.name: 2280. Podręcznik podstawowy
128617.description:
User's summary:

rulebook and campaign setting. Nicely formatted.

128618.name: Space Assault
128618.description:
User Summary:

Space Assault is a game by Magic Soft, a sidescrolling shoot'em up, where you fly a space ship. The game contains only of one level, one long stage (takes 30 min to play) and ends with a boss.

128619.name: The Stalk
128619.description:
From the Introduction:

The Stalk, like so many of the adventures crafted for the Original Campaign (OC), was meant as a diversified challenge for our veteran players. There was no exact placement for it within the campaign world, and for good reason: the players had become wary of the dungeons we had contrived with all their inherent dangers and had opted instead to do outdoor adventures.

User Summary:

A small "outdoor dungeon" (for characters of 9-12th level) that takes place in the vines of a giant plant.

This is not a bound book -- it's a set of 13 loose pages (plus two heavier-stock cover pages) in a plastic bag. The last three pages scans of Kuntz's original handwritten adventure from the 1975.

128620.description:
This Ogre terrain promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project, where BoardGameGeek pledged $9,000 for the creation and distribution of two sets of promos, one of which is this terrain promo (the other promo set is a set of 3D units!). Many ideas came from BoardGameGeek users, many others were devised by Steve Jackson, and all were finalized by Steve.

The result is a scenario designer's dream come true, as there is terrain in this set (the log-filled water, for instance) that is not in the rules but is left for the scenario designer. There are also many things that aren't standard Ogre canon. Various pieces are intended to work together. Here are some ideas that Steve Jackson suggests, for example:


- Dams, broken dams, downstream log-jams, and flooded towns are all designed to support destroy-the-dam scenarios.



- BGGsaurus from the 3-D sheet, and the terrain he has stomped through. Is it merely damaged, or has he left it radioactive or worse? And does he have some connection with the flying saucer?



- The big comm tower can just be a target, or it can be related to the flying saucer. Does it call the saucer? Does the saucer BUILD it? Maybe it's not actually a comm tower - those dishes could be super lasers!



- For that matter, is the giant glowing crater an exploded reactor, or is it what happens when the flying saucer takes too much damage?


Sheet 1 contains (front/back):


- Giant flying saucer / Giant CRASHED flying saucer



- Missile base (center control building, nine launch silos) / Shot-up missile base



- Flooded city (white buildings in blue water) / City devastated by BGGsaurus (footprints)



- Repair facility (road going through buildings, robot arms, and so on) / Wrecked version of repair facility



- Swamp shape with multiple streams (this would drastically slow anything but infantry) / Flopped on reverse



- Town hex completely surrounded by forest / Humongous crater



- Bank of radar dishes / Shot-up radars.


Sheet 2 contains (front/back):


- Two dams, one with a road over it and one not / Each has a broken version on the other side



- Airfield with road passing near / Shot-up airfield



- Coastal shape with forest / Coastal shape with burning rubble.



- Drowned city / Stomped city



- Three different-shaped overlays of flooded terrain choked with debris and logs (to use downstream from a broken dam) / Clear terrain with BGGsaurus footprints



- Humongous crater, but old and with plants regrowing on the inside / Humongous crater, full of water. The terrain inside the crater is NOT defined in the regular rules - it looks like shallow water filled with junk, but make of it what you will. Steve says he would not swim in it.


Both sheets also have some "dogleg" shapes for changing streams and ridges.
128620.name: Ogre: BGG Exclusive Overlays Sponsored Counter Sheets

128621.description:
In Viticulture, the players find themselves in the roles of people in rustic, pre-modern Tuscany who have inherited meager vineyards. They have a few plots of land, an old crushpad, a tiny cellar, and three workers. They each have a dream of being the first to call their winery a true success.

The players are in the position of determining how they want to allocate their workers throughout the year. Every season is different on a vineyard, so the workers have different tasks they can take care of in the summer and winter. There's competition over those tasks, and often the first worker to get to the job has an advantage over subsequent workers.

Fortunately for the players, people love to visit wineries, and it just so happens that many of those visitors are willing to help out around the vineyard when they visit as long as you assign a worker to take care of them. Their visits (in the form of cards) are brief but can be very helpful.

Using those workers and visitors, players can expand their vineyards by building structures, planting vines (vine cards), and filling wine orders (wine order cards). Players work towards the goal of running the most successful winery in Tuscany.
128621.name: Viticulture
boardgameexpansion: Tuscany: Expand the World of Viticulture
boardgamepodcastepisode: #19: Viticulture on tap, Quadropolis & TableTop Day
#30: Stephen Buonocore interview; The Dragon & Flagon on tap; Dice City & Viticulture
#84 – Tabletop – Scythe with Jamey Stegmaier
3. Devon Dice Podcast Presents... a review of 2015 part 1
9. Devon Dice Podcast - The Gallerist Review  and more

What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 99

128622.name: Leader of the Pack
rpgseries: ADAP - Living Forgotten Realms Adapted Adventures
128622.description:
From the front page of the PDF:
Three years ago, Zelgar Lightborn’s brother left the town of Silvergrail on a grand adventure and was cursed with lycanthropy. Now he’s returned, along with the rest of his pack. A Living Forgotten Realms adapted adventure set in the Moonshae Isles for Adventure Level 6 (character levels 3-9). At least one person at the table (either a player or the DM) must have an active subscription to D&D Insider. We recommend that you allow at least six hours of playing time to complete this adventure.

You must have a legal copy of the published adventure to use this document. “Leader of the Pack” is found in Issue 194 of Dungeon online, part of D&D Insider. Dungeon issues may be found on the Wizards of the Coast website (http://wizards.com/dnd). This adaptation document does not present adjusted stat blocks for low/high tier; the DM is expected to use the stat blocks from the published adventure and adjust as needed. Any LFR-legal AL 6 table may play this adventure, but bear in mind that the stat blocks in the adventure were written for a party of level 4-6 characters. Tables at the low end of the level band might find this adventure very difficult.

128623.name: Steading of the Hill Giant Chief (Living Forgotten Realms Adapted)
rpgseries: ADAP - Living Forgotten Realms Adapted Adventures
128623.description:
From the front page of the PDF:
Giants are raiding the civilized lands in large bands, visiting death and destruction upon villages, towns, and farmlands. Entire militias have been conquered, whole crops wiped out. Determined to repel the invaders, local lords have called for you to banish the marauding giants from the civilized lands. A Living Forgotten Realms adapted adventure set near the Evermoors for Adventure Level 12 (character levels 11-15).

This adventure is found in Issue 197 of Dungeon online, part of D&D Insider. Dungeon issues may be found on the Wizards of the Coast website (http://wizards.com/dnd). At least one person at the table (either a player or the DM) must have an active subscription to D&D Insider. This is the first part of the Against the Giants Major Quest. The other parts are ADAP4-4 Warrens of the Stone Giant Thane, ADAP4-5 Glacial Rift of the Frost Giant Jarl, and ADAP4-6 Halls of the Fire Giant King. You should play the parts in order. This is a very long adventure. We recommend that you allow at least fourteen hours of playing time.

This adaptation document does not present adjusted stat blocks for low/high tier; any LFR-legal AL 12 table can play, but bear in mind that the stat blocks in the adventure were written for a party of level 12-14 characters. Tables consisting entirely of brand- new 11th-level characters might find this adventure difficult; a table of all 15th-level characters might find it easy. The DM is encouraged to make adjustments as needed to ensure a fun time for the players and a challenging but fair experience for the PCs.

128624.name: Cracoviana
128624.description:
Cracoviana takes you for the walk throgh Cracow old streets, where you find traces of historical events, rulers and artists. We learn about the city, its climate, history and tradition. Great way to make you children and grandchildren learn about the city, while having great time

Game goal is to gather as many "Wall Blanks" as possible in shortest time. Whoever achieves this and reaches Wawel, wins.
Players move through fields that symbolize streets of Old Town.

On street crossings there are questions from 10 sets - Legends, Artists, Tratition, Monuments, Events and so on, whic you must answer in order to get "City Blanks".

128625.name: Bait and Switch
128625.description:
From the front page:

Bait and Switch
by Stephen Gabriel

A corporate suit dumped some trash and the Johnson wants you to pick him and the trash up and then leverage the suits boss with the evidence.

128626.name: Bloodstone
128626.description:
From the front page:

Bloodstone
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Nick Perch

A mysterious door discovered in the Canadian Rockies has caught Mr. johnson's interest. Looks like it's time for a trip.

128627.name: Auf der Flucht
128627.description:
Two player Deduction game.
Both player try to guess the position of a criminal, by asking their opponent Yes/No-Questions and deducing the taken escape route through Germany.
Part of the small "Black Criminal Card game" Series.

In the first part of the game the players lay out the route that one criminal took: For that he always combines citys with transportations (car, train, bus, plane, boat) that he uses for his getaway. 4 days of travelling is layed-out in this manner.
In the secon part the players take turns to ask Yes/no-Questions to find out the route taken. The players can ask anything about the route taken, but not about the final destination. So they can ask "Did you use the plane in those five days?" or "Did you pass through Austria on wendesday or thursday?" but not "Did you end up in Vienna?"
Once a player knows where his opponent was on each of those 4 days he can make a guess to win the game. If he guesses wrong he looses.

128628.name: Carpe Tigris
128628.description:
From the front page:
Carpe Tigris
A Two-Round Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Chris Maxfield and Mark Somers

In 2050, a team of runners performed a data steal on a megacorp facility in Tocoma that resulted in unfortunate, unintentional, third party casualties, some fatal. Two of the casualties were the wife and the younger daughter of Edmund Kim, a young and ambitious fincial expert. No one was ever bought to justice for these deaths. The time has come.

128629.name: A Death in the Family
128629.description:
From the front cover:
A Death in the Family
A Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Jason Reynolds

User summary:
Second installment in the "trilogy" of adventures centering around the Siracusa family.

128630.name: Digging Up a Mole
128630.description:
From the front page:
Digging Up a Mole
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Stephen Gabriel
The Johnson's mole has disappeared and his guardian is gone too. Tracking down the mole should be a piece of cake, just watch out for his former employer!

User summary:
The second scenario in a set of three interconnected scenarios. War in the Streets was the first. Second scenario in the Jonathan Nash series.

128631.name: End Run
128631.description:
From the front page:
End Run
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Tournament
by Stephen Gabriel

User summary:
A corp exec needs someone to nose around and expose a cult that has infiltrated his company. His past agent died; will you?

128632.name: Escort Service
128632.description:
From the front page:
Escort Service
A One-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
by Stephen W. Gabriel

A data carrier has hired Claudia to provide escort coverage for his entry into Seattle, a simple 4 hour contract. What could go wrong?

128633.name: Schräge Vögel
128633.description:
The birds are bothered by Carlo the cat! Who can help them to fly savely into the treetop and escape from Carlo? Schräge Vögel is a fresh game of chance, which trains motor skills.

Objective: Be the first flipping your cards into the treetop. Cards are taken & treetop is placed upon the table's centre; active player tries to flip a card into the treetop; in order to be flipped card is positioned that it sticks out of the table's edge. Depending where it drops player can add an additional card, take it back or even take more cards back to the own pile.

128634.name: Good Intentions
128634.description:
From the front cover:
Good Intentions
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Stephen Gabriel

A body was found in the harnou, and the Johnson who wants to hire you has a personal interest in tracking down the killer. Nuyen is nuyen, so this little run shouldn't stress you too much. Ask a few questions, lean on a few witnesses, get the truth. Easy.

128635.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Welcome to Saqqara (Egypt), the date is about 2125 BC, just before the Heracleopolis revolt.

Set in ancient Egypt in a time of chaos and revolts, Saqqara is a game with lots of bluffing, speculation and development for 3-5 players. The players assume the role of monarch in ancient Egypt and attempt to influence the country's government and economy. They send merchants to the market to collect goods to develop their province, recruit workers to build pyramids, and claim fertile land on the banks of the Nile. The player who succeeds in developing his province best by cunningly making use of the privileges of the pyramids and claiming a large area on the banks of the Nile wins the game and becomes Egypt's new leader.

Watch out for beggars, thieves and sneaky bluffing monarchs from other provinces. They want the same as you: power over Egypt.
128635.name: Saqqara

128636.name: The Hunter
128636.description:
From the fron page:
The Hunter
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Tournament
by Stephen Gabriel

From the Introduction:
The job is simple, escort a foreign nature show star on a romp through the North Amarican wilderness to see some paranormal animals in their natural environment.

128637.name: Missing Pieces
128637.description:
From the front page:
Missing Pieces
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Stephen Gabriel

An employee left the company with something that didn't belong to him and the Johnson wants it back. Find the employee and you've got the goods.

128638.name: O Passo do Carvalho
128638.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pequena vila de Passo do Carvalho anda sofrendo ataques freqüentes de um grupo de bandidos. Caravanas mercantes levando suprimentos à região mineradora estão evitando a aproximação, o que vem causando fome aos habitantes. Emissários do castelo "Portão do Inverno" oferecem uma boa recompensa a quem resolver o problema. Estaria você interessado?


Translation courtesy of Google:

The small town of Oak Step walks suffering frequent attacks of a group of bandits. Merchant caravans carrying supplies to the mining region are avoiding the approach, which has caused hunger to the people. Emissaries of the castle "Gates of Winter" offer a good reward for solving the problem. Would you be interested?

128639.name: A Ilha da Caveira
128639.description:
From publisher blurb:

Em a Ilha da Caveira os personagens são levados a investigar os perigos e mistérios de uma ilha e um grande tesouro de piratas em uma aventura pequena e perfeita para a apresentação do Old Dragon à jogadores inexperientes e para o uso em eventos. Supere seu o medo do mar, desafie os terríveis e perigosos pigmeus canibais e divirta-se à exaustão com a Ilha da Caveira!


Translation courtesy of Google:

In the Island of the Skull characters are taken to investigate the dangers and mysteries of an island and a large pirate treasure on a little adventure and perfect for the presentation of the Old Dragon inexperienced players and for use at events. Overcome your fear of the sea, challenge the terrible and dangerous pygmy cannibals and enjoy yourself to exhaustion with the Skull Island!

128640.name: A Árvore Morta dos Kobolds Infernais
128640.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rumores, crianças desaparecidas e um mistério pairando no ar. Elementos fundamentais para uma aventura ideal para aventureiros iniciarem suas carreiras de heróis.

Disponibilizada aos mestres no ODday 2011, a Árvore Morta dos Kobolds Infernais é uma aventura simples e curta, pensada para jogadores iniciantes e heróis de primeiro nível perfeita para ser mestrada em eventos ou como uma missão paralela em campanhas maiores.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Rumors, missing children and a mystery in the air. Key elements for an adventure ideal for adventurers start their careers as heroes.

ODday Offered to teachers in 2011, the Dead Tree of Kobolds Hell is an adventure short and simple, designed for beginners and first-level heroes to be perfect mestrada events or as a parallel mission in larger campaigns.

128641.name: Redemption
128641.description:
From the front page:
Redemption
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Scott Spencer and William Redd

The runners must make an investigation into the mind of a serial killer and come back again.

128642.name: Que as Aventuras Comecem!
128642.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mortos vivos assombrando uma catacumba, goblins bandoleiros prontos para o ataque e fazendeiros com problemas que nem eles mesmos imaginam!

“Que as Aventruas Comecem!” é uma compilação de 3 aventuras curtas, ideais para eventos, uma tarde casual de jogos ou para introduzir amigos ao RPG!

Cada aventura busca dar ênfase em um dos pilares do RPG: exploração de masmorras, combate e interpretação. Um mapa mostra a região e os pontos onde as aventuras ocorrem, podendo ser usadas em conjunto ou individualmente.

Preparem seus dados, e Que as Aventuras Comecem!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Living dead haunting a catacomb, goblin bandits ready to attack and farmers with problems that they themselves or imagine!
"That Aventruas Begin!" is a compilation of three short adventures, ideal for events, a casual afternoon of games or to introduce friends the RPG!

Each adventure seeks to focus on one of the pillars of RPG, dungeon exploration, combat and interpretation. A map shows the region and the points where the adventures take place, can be used together or individually.

Prepare your data, and Let the Adventure Begin!

128643.name: O Casamento (Old Dragon Edition)
128643.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uma missão, uma aventura e um casamento. Os personagens são contratados para escoltar uma caravana com destino a um casamento numa cidade próxima. No meio do caminho uma perigosa cordilheira montanhosa.

“O Casamento” é uma aventura curta para 3-5 personagens, para o 1º nível, ideal para seus jogadores começarem suas vidades de aventuras.

A Série “TA”: Muito mais que uma simples aventura, a publicação de O CASAMENTO para Old Dragon marca a história dos RPGs independentes no Brasil. Num momento raro no nosso mercado, fomos agraciados com o incentivo e apoio do Marcelo Rodrigues para publicarmos as aventuras do Tagmar 2 adaptadas para o Old Dragon. Pode parecer pouco, mas num mercado marcado pela divisão, esta é a soma com poder de multiplicação…


Translation courtesy of Google:

A mission, an adventure and a wedding. The characters are hired to escort a convoy bound for a wedding in a nearby town. Midway through a dangerous mountain range.

"Marriage" is a short adventure for 3-5 characters, for the 1st level, ideal for your players begin their adventure activities.

The Series "TA": Much more than a simple adventure, the publication of Marriage for Old Dragon marks the history of independent RPGs in Brazil. In a rare moment in our market, we were blessed with the encouragement and support of Marcelo Rodrigues to publish the adventures of two Tagmar adapted to the Old Dragon. It may seem little, but in a market marked by the division, this is the sum of multiplication with power ...

128644.name: Stolen Property
128644.description:
From the front cover:
Stolen Property
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Tournament
by Stephen W. Gabriel

From the introduction:
It's 6:30 AM and the ring of your phone is mixing with the sound of distant sirens and traffic.

Claudia pops ip on screen, "I've a job for you, som Johnson misplaced his cutlery. Go to the airport and open locker 2216. Inside is a box with the pertinent information on a datachip and a credstick with the retainer. There is also a folded up sword stand and two shuriken provided by the Johnson for the mages, althought I'm not sure what good this will do. This one is open and shut, find the sword and call me, then put the sword into locker 2216, the final payment will be waiting for you. Johnson is not interested in retribution abd he requests that this be done as neatly as possible. The total fee for this is 60k, the retainer is for 20k. You can pick up the key at the main information desk under (insert one of the character's names).

128645.name: O Mistério de Savih
128645.description:
From publisher blurb:

O vilarejo de Savih sempre foi pacato e sereno… Pelo menos até agora. Boatos de uma maldição desenterrada na capela local fazem com que os moradores percam sua fé, transformando o pequeno vilarejo num local amargo e desolado. Será tudo verdade? Estariam todos condenados pela falta de fé dos habitantes?

“O Mistério de Savih” é uma aventura curta para 3-5 personagens, para o 4º nível, ideal para seus jogadores evoluírem para o nível 5 e usarem as novas regras do Manual Básico do Old Dragon.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The village of Savih was always calm and serene ... At least until now. Rumors of a curse in the local chapel unearthed cause residents to lose their faith, transforming the small village in a bitter and desolate. Is it all true? Were all doomed by a lack of faith of the people?

"The Mystery of Savih" is a short adventure for 3-5 characters, to the 4th level, ideal for your players evolve to level 5 and use the new rules of the Basic Manual of Old Dragon.

128646.name: The Body Farm
128646.description:
From the front page:
The Body Farm
A Single Session Virtual Seattle Adventure
By Mark Somers

From the introduction:
With a rather bemused experssion on her face she will explain that the nature of this job is somewhat distasteful, but she expects that the often-elastic morals of teh runners should be able to cope. The mission is to gain posession of the whole body of Dr Robert Carling, without anyone knowing that they have done so. The good doctor - a forensic examiner with the Seattle Coroner's Office - died two months ago. He was buried in Bellevue, in quite a nice marble edifice.

128647.name: Kobolds
128647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Este artigo traz pela primeira vez, estatísticas completas e oficiais para Kobolds. Crie e jogue com Kobolds na sua mesa.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This article presents the first time, complete and official statistics for Kobolds. Create and play at your table with Kobolds.

128648.name: The Nanny
128648.description:
From the front page:
The Nanny
A One Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
by Stephen W. Gabriel

A girl and her nanny have turned up missing, victims of a corporate war. Your job is simple, find them and bring them back. Too bad nothing is simple in the shadows.

128649.name: Gnomos
128649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Este artigo traz pela primeira vez, estatísticas completas e oficiais para os Gnomos, e suas principais sub-raças.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This article presents the first time, complete and official statistics for the Gnomes, and its main sub-races.

128650.name: War in the Streets
128650.description:
From the front page:
War in the Streets
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Stephen Gabriel

There's something bad out there and you've been selected to go clean it up. Oh, did the Johnson tell you there will be others out there looking for it?

First scenario in the Jonathan Nash series.

128651.name: What If They Get Off the Isle?
128651.description:
'From the front page:
What If They Get Off the Isle?
A One-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
by Ed De Jesus

Shadowrunners on vacation - that will be the day, but what else could drag a Tyger team down into the Caribbeab League, unless it's about another big payday.

128652.name: Rações
128652.description:
From publisher blurb:

Um dos itens mais críticos da lista de equipamentos é a ração de viagem. Não porque seja difícil de imaginar sua função, afinal é comida preparada e empacotada para o personagem levar quando sai explorando o mundo; mas sim porque é complicado imaginar o que a compõe! E para lhe ajudar a pensar em tudo sobre rações de viagem um artigo completo com 17 páginas explorando cores, sabores e muitas tabelas sobre comida!


Translation courtesy of Google:

One of the most critical items of equipment list is the feed travel. Not because it's hard to imagine its function, after all food is prepared and packaged for the character to take when you go out exploring the world, but because it is hard to imagine what the make up! And to help you think about everything about travel rations an article complete with 17 pages exploring colors, flavors and food on many tables!

128653.name: Willing to Sell a Soul
128653.description:
From the front page:
Willing to Sell a Soul
A One Round Shadowrun 3rd edition Virtual Seattle Adventure
By Richard L. Dold

In the heat of the momnet, in the middle of conflict, runners are forced to make many difficult dicisions. A man's dead bady has been taken, so what? There is more to this than meets the eye. Then again, isn't there always.

128654.name: Gárgulas
128654.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uma fera que é tanto homem quanto morcego, sem contudo chegar a ser nenhum deles completamente. Estátuas de pedra que ganham vida à noite. Será que um bravo herói consegue sobreviver ao ataque voraz de um homem-morcego? As gárgulas de pedra sobre o castelo são meras estátuas ou guardiães da noite, incansáveis e determinados?

Este artigo traz estatísticas completas de duas novas criaturas para o Old Dragon, o Homem-Morcego e a Gárgula de Pedra, além de trazer dois possíveis ganchos de aventuras ligados a elas.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A beast that is both man and bat, but without getting to be neither completely. Stone statues that come alive at night. Does a brave hero manages to survive the onslaught of a voracious man-bat? The stone gargoyles on the castle are mere statues or guardians of the night, tireless and determined?

This paper presents comprehensive statistics of two new creatures to the Old Dragon, Man-Bat and Gargoyle Stone, and bring two possible adventure hooks linked to them.

128655.name: Jagdrevier
128655.description: Murder! A body has been found in the idyllic woods of the Allgäu, one of Germany's most popular holiday areas. Side by side with commissioner Kluftinger (famous from a series of German crime novels), the players in Jagdrevier start their investigations to reveal the murderer. Each turn, the gamemaster places hints and clues in different places located in the Allgäu (e.g., Schloss Neuschwanstein). Each player travels from place to place, putting the clues together to deduce the murderer and his or her motive – but time is running and not every clue will contribute to the solution. Only the most quick-witted player can win this game!

128656.name: Babar und die Abenteuer von Badou: Das Kartenspiel
128656.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Badou, the grandson of the elephant king Babar, loves to go on adventures with his friends – but it's time to leave on the next outing and he can't find them! In Babar und die Abenteuer von Badou: Das Kartenspiel, the players need to help Badou find his missing friends so that they can take off!

128657.name: Babar und die Abenteuer von Badou: Das spannende Suchspiel
128657.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Badou, Babar, and their friends want to use colored chalk to bring children into their jungle school – but alas, their friends have taken off running down the wrong roads. Can the players go after this motley army of youngsters and help them find the right path?

128658.description:
Heptalion is a special tiling game played on a diamond-shaped board of 56 squares depicting seven different symbols on them. Two players randomly draw tiles, but position them face up. The players struggle to place their 2-square tiles on the board so that both symbols of the tile match with the symbols of the two adjacent spaces on which the tile is placed. The last player placing a tile wins.

The special board configuration has the following properties:


Each symbol is shown exactly eight times.
Each domino is shown exactly three times.
There are exactly 56 squares; the same number of squares that compose the 28 tiles.


A variant for three and four players is included in the rules.
128658.name: Heptalion

128659.name: 謎解きバトルＴＯＲＥ！宝探しアドベンチャー 魔宮攻略ＧＡＭＥ
128659.description:
Based on the popular Japanese game show, TORE! is a game where 2 to 4 players compete against each other in challenges and quizzes to try to earn the most golden Pharaoh Statues and win the game. The expansive board is built up as a three-dimensional play space representing the various chambers of the cursed temple from the TV show.

In this board game version, the players move together through five of the popular rooms of the TORE! Temple. First they try to avoid being eaten by the stone monster in the "Stone Idol Chamber" then they must race to avoid being crushed by the closing walls in the "Wall Chamber". After that, their task is to not get wrapped up in the "Mummy Chamber" before next trying to escape from the "Floor Chamber" where the ground slowly rises until the hapless player slides off to the their doom. Finally, in the "Cliff Chamber", the players must use their wits as they are quizzed one-by-one while portions of the walls begin to protrude, threatening to push them over into the bottomless abyss.

Interspersed between these five rooms are additional challenges including quizzes, gambling to win more Golden Pharaohs, and even the ultra-popular "Spring of the Goddess" metal-ball challenge of trying to control and drop a ball into a goal using two ramp-like bars.

TORE! is a game of both chance and skill as your brain and ability to stay cool under pressure will help you as much as a lucky die roll. All the while the game maintains the same light-hearted humor from the TV show.

From the game rules (translated):
This game is a three-dimensional board game of trying to find the "Golden Pharaoh Statues" hidden in the cursed temple! Try to escape from the Pharaoh's many challenges while collecting more Pharaoh Statues than your opponents!

128660.description:
The seventh scenario pack produced by Le Franc Tireur.

The ten scenarios included are:

- The Road to Juniville- French vs. German. La Neuville, France 10 June 1940
- Getting your bell rung- British vs. German. Sanfatucchio Italy, 21 June 1944
- Clearing the LZ- American vs. German. Grosbeak Heights, Nijmegen Holland. 18 September 1944
- A misstep in Lorraine- American vs. German Near Vaudrecourt, France. 20 September 1944
- Green berets- British vs. German. Flushing Walcheren Island, Holland, 1 November 1944
- Dover bunker- British vs German. Flushing Walcheren Island, Holland, 2 November 1944
- Inter-allied attack- British vs German. Domburg, Walcheren Island, Holland 3 November 1944
- Bloodier than D-Day- Allies vs German. Vrouwenpolder, Walcheren Island, Holland 7 November 1944
- Niederburg Farmhouse- American vs German. Near Bettendorf, Luxembourg 18 December 1944
- Landstorm over Arnhem- British vs German. Near Arnhem Holland. 14 April 1945

All are ETO actions. Scenario length estimates range from 1 hour 45mins to 5 hours.
128660.name: From the Cellar: Pack 7

128661.name: Taslois
128661.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pequenos mas formidáveis inimigos, estes humanóides das selvas e florestas tropicais, superam sua baixa estatura com as mais engenhosas tácticas de combate. Transofmar o nada em vantagem é a principal arma de um Tasloi no campo de combate.

Este artigo visa apresentar os Taslois de forma completa e totalmente ambientada. Não deixando as regras de lado, mas focando-se enormemente nas descrições e ambientações acerca da criatura. Apostamos que após ler este material, você jamais verá os Taslois com os mesmos olhos!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Small but formidable enemies, these humanoids from the jungles and rainforests, overcome their stature with the most ingenious combat tactics. Transofmar nothing into the main advantage is a Tasloi weapon on the battlefield.

This article aims to present the Taslois completely and totally ambientada. Leaving aside the rules, but focusing greatly on the descriptions and settings about the creature. We bet that after reading this material, you will never see the Taslois with the same eyes!

boardgamedesigner: Diego Martín de las Pueblas Encinas
128662.description:
The Northwest Passage is a sea route that lies between northern Canada and the North Pole, joining the Atlantic and Pacific oceans. The first expeditions took place after the discovery of America due to the need of the English to connect both coasts of the Americas to avoid edging the whole continent. However, it was not until the beginning of the 20th century when the adventurous spirit of sailors led them to discover this passage.

The goal of Northwest Passage Adventure – a game of strategy and wit based on a historical adventure, with a playing time of ten minutes per player – is simple: Be the first to discover the Northwest Passage with the help of nothing more than your ship and your ingenuity. We'll have to go tracing the most favorable route as the scenario takes shape, always 4-row vision. We will have to manage wisely our progress chips and exploit our character ability. We will also have the help of the treasures that we will find on the way. The player that crosses first the last row, row 24, wins.
128662.name: Northwest Passage Adventure

128663.name: Justas
128663.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Seu cavalo avança velozmente, enquanto você aponta a lança em direção ao peito do adversário. Estilhaços voam para todos os lados quando a ponta de sua arma explode no escudo do oponente. Abalado pelo impacto do golpe, ele retira o elmo, arremessando-o no chão num sinal de fúria. Para ele, a batalha havia sido perdida, e você mostrou a supremacia de sua técnica!”

“Justas” é um artigo que trata sobre esta modalidade desportiva disputada pelos cavaleiros e nobres, que buscam mostrar suas habilidades de combate numa forma menos mortal do que um campo de batalha. Com regras completas e facilmente adaptável, “Justas” trás ainda idéias de como inseri-las epicamente em suas aventuras!


Translation courtesy of Google:

"Your horse moves forward quickly, while you point the spear into the chest of the opponent. Shrapnel flying in all directions when the tip of your gun explodes in the shield of the opponent. Shaken by the impact of the blow, he removes his helmet, knocking him down as a sign of anger. For him, the battle had been lost, and you showed the supremacy of his technique! "

"Fair" is an article about this sport is played by knights and nobles who seek to show their fighting skills in a less deadly than a battlefield. With complete rules and easily adaptable, "Fair" back even ideas of how epically insert them in their adventures!

boardgamehonor: 2012 Årets Spel Best Adult Game Nominee
2012 Årets Spel Best Adult Game Winner
128664.description:
Timeline is a card game played using 220 cards. Each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

This version of the Timeline game combines cards from the three already published French Timeline games. Cards are bigger so it's not compatible with previous releases.

In addition to the card game the box also contains a CD with the computer version of the game, with even more events, discoveries and inventions.
128664.name: Timeline
boardgamepodcastepisode: 7LandHand: Episode 45 – Mini Game Special

128665.name: Fluxovida
128665.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crie históricos de personagens com muitos detalhes e extrema facilidade usando o nosso fluxovida. Um método aleatório (ou não) de geração de background e personalidade que vai adicionar muito mais vida aos seus personagens, além de auxiliar o mestre da sua mesa a criar histórias paralelas e cheias de integração com a sua campanha.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Create historical characters with lots of detail and ease using our fluxovida. A random (or not) to generate background and personality that will add more life to their characters, besides assisting the master of your table to create parallel stories and full integration with your campaign.

128666.description:
Game description from the publisher:

To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the best-selling BANG!, dV Giochi will present this limited edition version. BANG! 10th Anniversary is packaged in a metal box and includes all the BANG! playing cards, plus a selection of popular characters – the "Most Wanted", if you will – from all the released expansions of BANG!. In addition, the game will feature deluxe components such as wooden bullets and maxi-sized player boards. To top it all off, this edition will include three previously unpublished characters and a brand new player board!

"The Outlaws hunt the Sheriff. The Sheriff hunts the Outlaws. The Renegade plots secretly, ready to take one side or the other. Bullets fly. Who among the gunmen is a Deputy, ready to sacrifice himself for the Sheriff? And who is a merciless Outlaw, willing to kill him? If you want to find out, just draw (your cards)!" (From back of box)

This card game recreates an old-fashioned spaghetti western shoot-out, with each player randomly receiving a Character card to determine special abilities, and a secret Role card to determine their goal.

Four different Roles are available, each with a unique victory condition:
Sheriff - Kill all Outlaws and the Renegade
Deputy - Protect the Sheriff and kill any Outlaws
Outlaw - Kill the Sheriff
Renegade - Be the last person standing
A player's Role is kept secret, except for the Sheriff. Character cards are placed face-up on table, and also track strength (hand limit) in addition to special ability.

There are 22 different types of cards in the draw deck. Most common are the BANG! cards, which let you shoot at another player, assuming the target is within "range" of your current gun. The target player can play a "MISSED!" card to dodge the shot. Other cards can provide temporary boosts while in play (for example, different guns to improve your firing range) and special one-time effects to help you or hinder your opponents (such as Beer to restore health, or Barrels to hide behind during a shootout). A horse is useful for keeping your distance from unruly neighbors, while the Winchester can hit a target at range 5. The Gatling is a deadly exception where range doesn't matter - it can only be used once, but targets all other players at the table!

Information on the cards is displayed using language-independent symbols, and 7 summary/reference cards are included.
128666.name: BANG! 10th Anniversary
boardgameexpansion: BANG! Dodge City with High Noon expansion
BANG! High Noon/A Fistful of Cards

128667.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Samurai Sword is a game based on the proven Bang! mechanisms and set in feudal Japan. In this game, the familiar features of Bang! are enhanced by more dynamic and fast-paced game play, and thanks to a new scoring system – based on honor points and resilience points – there is no player elimination. Everybody gets to fight to the very end! Also, weapons and attacks are fused into a single card.
128667.name: Samurai Sword

128668.name: Banditos: Hippies and an Armored Truck
128668.description:
Go on a joyride through the 1980s. Your destination? Robbing the Banco de Mexico!

Now there are even more ways to make your millions with Banditos: Hippies and an Armored Truck, a 30-card expansion for Banditos that introduces four new characters, new cards for the action card deck, and inside information for the armored truck.

128669.name: Dungeons of Dredmor: Conquest of the Wizardlands
128669.description:
Harness the expanded storage space of your very own Pocket Dimension where interdimensional gnomes probably won’t steal all your crafting-junk.

Explore the Wizardlands by trading Wizarding Graffiti with your friends and enemies alike to gain access to the fractured extra-dimensional domains of the Wizards.

Encrust your Equipment with our powerful new Encrusting System! Upgrade weapons and armour with powerful crusts, offering special abilities and horrifying instability effects as crust is encrusted upon crust!

Tackle new foes from the terrifyingly fun Baron Samedi to the small and annoying Cloud Gremlins who shoot small and annoying lightning bolts at you! Beware the Monstrous Rutabaga, scourge of the Vikings, who will run you down at unexpected speed with their monstrous dash ability.

New Monstrous Menagerie and Trophy Room menu screens to compel you further toward obsessive collectivism!

Diggle Hell. It’s a real place and you will go there if you are naughty. Beware the dark power of Vlad Digula!

A Whack of new skills: Communist, Bankster, Egyptian Magic, Magical Law, Paranormal Investigator, and Tourist!

Source: The Publisher Website.

128670.name: Distant Star
128670.description:
Distant Star is an old-school 4X (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, eXterminate) space game for the iPad, iPhone, and iPod Touch, similar to Master of Orion or Sword of the Stars. Build up your fleet and conquer the galaxy -- will your empire be an economic powerhouse, a technological wonder, or a military superpower? Or all three?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2013 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Experten Recommended
128671.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery, an exciting game of twisted schemes and bloody combats inspired by the hit STARZ Original series, each player takes on the role of Dominus, head of a rising house in the ancient Roman city of Capua. Each house is competing for Influence to gain the favor of Rome. Through a combination of political schemes and glorious battles on the arena sands your house will rise in fame and stature. As Dominus, you have a variety of resources at your disposal. Guards protect you from schemes launched by rivals. Slaves run your household and earn gold. Gladiators compete to bring glory to themselves and influence to their Dominus.

Three main phases occur in each game round of Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery.

The Intrigue Phase is when players launch their Schemes, hoping to raise their fortunes while undermining their rivals. Schemes and Reactions are represented by cards in the Intrigue Deck. Players wield their Influence to put their Schemes into play, often asking for (or bribing) another player’s help in hatching the most complex plots.

The Market Phase is when players buy, sell and trade Assets (Gladiators, Slaves, Equipment and Guards). Players also bid against each other to acquire new Assets at Auction. Wealth is not the only path to success as players bluff and bargain with each other to acquire the Assets they covet.

The Arena Phase is when the bloody games are held. Gladiators from two rival Houses are pitted against each other in a brutal fight for glory. The spectacles of the games are represented by miniature combat on the arena board. Fighters pit their Attack, Defense and Speed dice against one another to determine the victor. All players seek to increase their fortunes by betting on the outcome of the gruesome conflict. Fighters who emerge from the arena victorious gain Favor and their Dominus gain Influence.

The goal of the game is to become the most influential house in Capua, securing your family’s power for years to come. During the game, players will bribe, poison, betray, steal, blackmail, and undermine each other. Gold will change hands again and again to buy support, stay someone’s hand or influence their decisions. Will you be the honorable player whose word is their bond or the treacherous schemer whose alliances change with the wind?
128671.name: Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
boardgameexpansion: Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery – House Calavius
Spartacus: Champions of House Batiatus Card Set
Spartacus: The Serpents and the Wolf Expansion Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: Allt på ett kort #6 – Spartacus
AP Podcast – Episodio 3: Especial Terrinoth
AP Podcast – Episodio 4: La Villa vs Spartacus
D6G Ep 111: Spartacus Detailed Review & GenCon Highlights
Downtime, December 2012: Secret Santa
Episode 2 - Living and Trading in the Net
Episode 22 - Jazz Hands!
Episode 27: Pt. 1 - Totally Confused Again
Episode 3 - The Vault
Episode 30: Spartacus: A Game of Blood and Treachery, No Game Left Behind and RPG Encounter Design
Episode 32 : Spartacus Board Game Review + Black Maple Hill
Episodio 8 – A Victory Denied y ¿qué son los wargames?
ET47: Sangre, sudor y gloria construyendo el ferrocarril.
Exp, December 2012: Drinking Spartacus
The Boardroom - Episode one!
The One About Being Super
Who Dares Rolls Podcast – Episode 4 – Spartacus

128672.description:
Greetings Semi-Intelligence: 221-B, and welcome to sentience. Upon completion of your training download, you will commence operation of Mining and Delivery Probe 4. Your task is to extract valuable materials from extrasolar planetoids and deliver the appropriate amounts of each to their target locations. It is imperative that these deliveries be made at any cost.

In the uncertain days leading up to the destructive Cataclysm of Earth, humans have settled other worlds and created robotic vessels to perform manual labor throughout their civilization. You will take on the role of one of these artificial intelligences tasked with mining asteroids for rare minerals and ice water, and delivering them to the colonies of humanity.

The goal of Ricochet Rock Jockeys is to retrieve goods from the Asteroid Fields between Earth and its colonies, and deliver them. You will explore the space surrounding Earth, mine asteroids, and make deliveries – all while vying for position with other players attempting to mine those same asteroids and make those same deliveries. Ricochet Rock Jockeys is an extremely fast-paced game of chance, delivery, and crashing spaceships.

Players start with a ship on Earth, then move that ship to explore, mine, and deliver mined goods. Players can bump into other players' ships, taking or losing goods based upon the strength of the impact. Players gain victory points for each successful delivery. Once the pool of victory points is exhausted, the player with the most VPs wins!
128672.name: Ricochet Rock Jockeys

128675.name: Schnoz-Ola
128675.description:
User Summary:

A clone of the arcade classic Crystal Castles.

128676.name: Sewermania
128676.description:
From the manual/box cover:

"A subterranean search full of...ugh...crawly creatures."

128677.name: Sneggit
128677.description:
From the manual/box cover:

"Save the eggs! Hungry snakes are in the barnyard, devouring your eggs by the dozen. You must survive the reptilian attack and save as many eggs as possible."

128678.name: CrazyQuest
128678.description:
User Summary: walkie

CrazyQuest is a "massively singleplayer", online, turn-based RPG. The core of the game is a retro-style, hack-and-slash RPG, featuring point-to-point movement, leveling, upgradeable skills, and loot.

Although the game is fundamentally single player, a unique feature is a shared chat room in which all active players can talk, and view each others stats and equipment.

The theme is a combination of standard fantasy with surreal and humorous additions. For example, dungeons include the expected swamp, crypt, and volcano, but also Mario and Alice in Wonderland spoofs, and the bowels of a sick ogre.

128679.name: Space Bandits
128679.description:
From the manual/box cover:

"Come treasure hunting in a 3-D maze...if you dare!"

128680.name: St. Nick
128680.description:
From the back of the box:

"Evil witches have cast a spell on Santa's elves--turning these nice folks into positively mean critters! The elves have stolen the toys from Santa's workshop and scattered them all over. You must help St. Nick collect the toys in time or he'll be late for Christmas!"

128681.name: Superfly
128681.description:
From the box/manual cover:

"Will the fly survive the cosmic bug attack?"

User Summary

This is a sequel to the earlier TI-99 game, The Attack.

128683.name: Console Romano
128683.description:
In the board game Console Romano, players are Roman citizens who try to expand their power in the city of Rome, while resources are stored in preparation for war with other countries. When war occurs, if you can supply resources for the military services, you receive honor points.

Console Romano has an action-selection system in which players will sometimes become "magistrate" to propose particular political tactics – i.e., actions – to the other players. Whoever with the most honor points wins.

128684.name: Clacto 6
128684.description:
Collection of 6 boardgames based on the use of magnetic marbles (clickets) as game pieces.

The box contains six games. Each of the games is a combination of the nature of the magnetic marbles (e.g. magnetism) and strategic or random placement of the marbles on the board.

The object is to place or remove those magnetic marbles without moving or disturbing the marbles still occupying holes on the gamebord.

CLACTO HARLEQUIN is a game of dice, not unlike the traditional game, but combined with the magnetic force of the 'clickets' the game gets a somewhat wider perspective. Apart from the placement of the clickets of the board as the throw of the dice indicates, the players have tot take the magnetism in account.

The same principle goes for CLACTO DICE.

CLACTO FISH is about removing clickets from the gameboard without disturbing the other clickets.

CLACTO 4 AND 4, CLACTO TACTIC and CLACTO SNAKES all have the placement of clickets on the board as subject, without moving or disturbing the clickets allready placed.

128685.name: Clacto Snakes
128685.description: Game based on the use of magnetic marbles (clickets). The object is to place all the clickets on the games board (in the shape of a snake), without moving them as a result of magnetic attraction.The player who succeeds in placing his last clicket without disturbing the other marbles on the board wins the game.

128687.name: Hearts in Glorantha (Issue 5 - Summer 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Through The Eye Of The Dragon
128687.description:
From the contents page:

* Credits & Features

Humakti Feature
* Hu Of The Nine Silences by Jane Williams
* Humakti Hyphen by Jane Williams
* Humakt Chaosbringer by Laurent Ailet
* Heroic Tales by Various
* Aldran by Newt Newport
* Foundry by Newt Newport
* Anaxial's Annex by Jamie 'Trotsky' Revell
* The Peace Process by Neil Smith
* Ships and their Crews by Nick Davison
* Through The Eye Of The Dragon by Newt Newport

128688.name: Wyrms Footnotes (Issue 15 - Volume IV, Number 1 - December 2011
rpgissuearticle: Magical Regiments In The Hero Wars
Making Of King Of Dragon Pass 2.0
Songs Of The House Of Sartar
The Battle Of Night And Day
128688.description:
From the back cover:

The World of Glorantha is a place of fantasy, mythology, adventure, warfare, romance and horror. It is a place of gods and heroes, thieves and adventurers ...

In the heart of the Kingdom of Sartar lies the Upland Marsh, home to the eternal Delecti the Necromancer. He and his Dancers of Darkness bid you welcome ...

In Sartar's Woods of the Dead, on the darkest nights, you may encounter an entrancing young nobleman riding a jet black steed. He offers you a simple choice ...

These are a but a few of the stories found within this latest issue of Wyrms Footnotes.

After a mere 30 year hiatus, Moon Design Publications is relaunching this flagship Gloranthan magazine with issue #15. It is suitable for use with any roleplaying system that uses Glorantha as its game world.

128689.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – The Fridge
128689.description:
Fridge is heavy combat brain. It commands other machines, thinks for them, optimizes tactics. Fridge constantly scans battlefield for any changes that could affect Moloch actions.

This set contains 1 Fridge mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128690.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Assault Troopers
128690.description:
Assault troopers. Equipped with assault carbines and kevlar body suits are elite among Outpost forces. They are assigned to hardest tasks, as no one else can defend positions as fiercely as they.

Assault troopers set contains 2 troopers, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128691.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Punks
128691.description:
Punks believe in motto "Leave and let die". They like to party, their lives are intense but short. They act in large groups, so their machine pistols can spit out rain of bullets

Punks set contains 2 punks, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128692.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Cokes
128692.description:
Cokes look like a bear. To get to that point you need a lot of bulls cojones and a lot of coke. He is hard as rock and just as stupid. Andrenaline makes him even more dangerous - when injured he can send whole squads to the grave.

Cokes set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128693.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Mutanci Borgo – Mesmeryta
128693.description:
Mesmerite is made for special tasks. As he approaches his enemies he attacks their brainwaves with mental noise, making them see invisible flame walls and feel pain which is not there. In the meantime other Borgo units can safely accomplish their tasks.

Mesmerite set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128695.description:
Iron Curtain - Patton’s Nightmare is a brand-new book that kicks off a new alternate-history arc for Panzer Grenadier, similar in scope and concept to the Second Great War arc just launched for Second World War at Sea. This will provide a common background for late-1940’s tactical combat with Pershings, JS III’s and Centurions in a world where the Cold War never happened – it turned hot almost right away.

Patton’s Nightmare, the book, has 77 die-cut-and-mounted American counters, with 20 completely new scenarios and a campaign game featuring the exploits of the 2nd “Hell on Wheels” Armored Division as it smashes the Red hordes.
128695.name: Panzer Grenadier: Iron Curtain – Patton's Nightmare
boardgameexpansion: Panzer Grenadier: Iron Curtain – Red & White

128696.name: At Home in Sunderland
128696.description:
A mathematical card game. The cards feature somewhere interesting in Sunderland, which is in the northeast of England.

Each card has a number between 0 and 9, except for the Double cards. Each player gets 6 cards and must look to see if a pair can be formed. A pair is made up of two numbers that, when multiplied together, make a total that is also on one of the two cards. For instance, you play a 5 and an 8 which makes 40. Thus the number 40 must also be on one of the two cards played. If successful, a pair is formed and can be laid face-up in front of the player. The first player to lay three pairs (6 cards) wins the round.

When a round is one, the other players add up the value of the cards in their hand and that is their score. After 12 rounds, the lowest score is the winner.

There are special rules for the Double Cards which you need to play because if you are caught with them in your hand when a player goes out, you get a nasty negative score.

This is an expanded game (but more subtle and a better design of the cards) that first appeared as Multitu in the 1960's.

128697.name: Multitu
128697.description:
A mathematical card game which first appeared in 1964. The cards feature numbers and you must form pairs. A pair consist of a total on one of the two cards that is equalled when the two cards played are multiplied together.

If you use all your cards first, the round ends and the player going out scores nothing but the other players take a negative score based on the cards still in their hands.

To spice up play, there are Problem Cards which are nasty if you get caught with them in your hand when another player goues out. One of them is Mr Whacker, a school teacher who seems to like caning his pupils.

128698.description:
In a foreboding castle somewhere in central Europe, a strange fear has descended upon the inhabitants. One morning the body of a young girl was found, as pale as a sheet of paper, dry and totally drained of blood. Vampires are on the prowl! Who is the monster who murders innocent during the night? Before the truth will be discovered, more than one person may face unjust accusations thrown out by the devious servants of darkness. Will the vampires be successfully caught before they endanger the entire society, or will the castle and city fall forever into darkness?

Three characters in the castle are vampires. A human investigator is trying to determine which three of nine characters he encounters are, in fact, monsters hiding in human form so that he can eliminate them. The head vampire, on the other hand, must bluff cleverly, present confusing clues, and trick the humans into attacking innocent citizens. By doing this, the vampire can kill the most important characters in the city or conquer the castle.

Vampire Empire is a two-player card game with a lot of bluffing and player interaction. In this very thematic setting, each player possess a unique deck of cards granting different powers, and each player had different goals to win the game!
128698.name: Vampire Empire
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23 - Unpub 6 and a Slew of New Hotness
Garrett's Games 369 - Vampire Empire and Sushi Go!
OBG 113: Hey New Guy

128699.name: Diet Without Tears
128699.description:
Educational card game published by the British Diabetic Association. It is an attempt to make people think about what they eat, especially for them to know the calorie count of their meals.

In it's basic form, players can just ask each other about a card, for instance: " Find me another card with the same calorie count as X".
But two more interactive games are possible. In 'Shop Shut' (for which you need two copies of the game) each player gets a hand of cards. One player is nominated as the Caller. Everyone plays their cards face up in front of them. The Caller draws a card and if a player has the same card, he shouts "Sold" and turns the card over. This continues until one player turns over his last card and then shouts "Shop Shut". That player scores nothing but the other players score their cards still 'open' by totalling the Carbohydrates on the card (or the Calorie count if decided before the game begins). After a pre-agrred time limit expires, the player with the lowest score wins.

In 'Happy Food Families, it plays exactly the same as a Happy Families/Quartet/Authors game. A set of four cards must all be the same food value as indicated on the card. The player who has the most sets when the cards run out, wins.

128700.name: Tetsubo
128700.description:
From the Introduction:

This is a work in progress and therefore incomplete, based on an Oriental supplement that we originally wrote using the Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay rules.

Our intention with Tetsubo now is to convert it to the Fabled Lands RPG (itself a work in progress) and modify the setting to Akatsurai, the easternmost country of the Fabled Lands. As well as fully revising the background, we will reinstate the missing sections (marked here in red) and add a scenario section.

The new work will then be released as the FL RPG and the first of twelve planned sourcebooks. And yes, we are hoping to do that this lifetime.

Other Tetsubo material can be ordered from Robert Rees here.

128701.name: Upgrade Wars
128701.description:
Far in the future, war has been relegated to a spectator sport. As humanity has spread throughout the solar system, advances in material sciences have left us wanting for nothing yet craving new forms of entertainment.

3D printers ranging in size from minuscule to mammoth process material known as Nano-Goo (or just “Goo”) into virtually anything a person could need, from food and clothing to massive, space-faring ships. Using these technologies, a few enterprising individuals capitalized on humanity’s need for entertainment and have brought back to life the ancient custom of gladiatorial combat -- done safely by remotely operating (teleoperating) vastly powerful machines of war known as War Bots.

Large 3D printing structures are dropped onto remote asteroids and other small, celestial bodies. These come with a small complement of devices which begin to process the raw materials of these asteroids into Goo, which these massive printers can use to create War Bots. Printers use a series of programs called .WAR Files, which give them the specifics of War Bots which they can then use Goo to print.

War Bots are printed out of Goo, which is programmed to take a specific form with specific functions. Because they are made of self organizing nanomaterials, War Bots can be modified by simple programs called .UPGrade Files – or upgrades. These upgrades can be applied to War Bots while they are in the field.

Governed by a strict set of rules, and limited by the programs made available to them, contestants manufacture and then fight with these giant machines, for the delight of audiences throughout the Solar System.

Upgrade Wars is a deck building, tactical combat game. Players begin the game with a starter deck of 10 resources and two War Bots (the giant robots that do the actual fighting).

Through the course of the game, they may purchase new programs to deploy as War Bots or to Upgrade existing War Bots that have already been deployed.

The battle field is divided into three zones - the Printer zone (where the magic happens), the Defensive Ring and the Front Line - a zone shared by all players.

Your bots traverse the battlefield under your command in an attempt to reach other player's printers and destroy them.

Complete Victory: The last player with a Printer still capable of creating War Bots wins the game!
Tactical Victory: Each enemy War Bot you destroy is worth 1 Victory Point. Each enemy Printer is worth 5 Victory Points. Once three card piles are depleted, the player with the most Victory Points wins!

Featuring strategic and tactical play - players must decide where and when to spend their resources, which can go to either purchasing new program files or deploying War Bots into the field of battle. At the same time, you must manage your existing War Bots to defend your Printer and attack the enemy.

128702.name: Perícias
128702.description:
From publisher blurb:

O Guia de Perícias para o Old Dragon possui um sistema completo e detalhado de perícias para que você possa adicionar um pouco mais de detalhes aos seus jogos. E se mesmo assim você não estiver satisfeito, este guia trás ainda três subsitemas totalmente diferentes e independentes, com variado grau de complexidade e realismo para você escolher o que melhor se encaixa na proposta de jogo da sua mesa.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Getting Skills for the Old Dragon has a complete and detailed skills so you can add a little more detail to their games. And if you still are not satisfied, this guide back Subsystems are three totally different and independent, with varying degrees of complexity and realism for you to choose what best fits the proposed game of his desk.

128703.name: Combate
128703.description:
From publisher blurb:

Se você preza pelo combate, e o que você quer é potencializar esta experiência com seu personagem sem a necessidade de um imenso número de poderes, talentos ou manobras especiais, talvez esse seja o seu suplemento.

Este livro propõe lançar uma nova luz a temas antigos, bem como mostrar novos caminhos, inserindo novas opções. Depois de lê-lo, os seus Homens de Armas nunca mais serão os mesmos!


Translation courtesy of Google:

If you value the fighting, and what you want is to leverage this experience with your character without the need for a huge number of powers, talents or special maneuvers, maybe this is your supplement.

This book proposes to launch a new light on old themes, and show new ways, entering new options. After reading it, his arms Men will never be the same!

128704.name: Guia de Equipamentos
128704.description:
From publisher blurb:

Equipamentos em jogos medievais possuem importância acima da média de outros gêneros. Viver num buraco profundo e escuro, isolado de tudo, em locais inóspitos sem qualquer vida não hostil nas redondezas, faz parte da rotina de todo aventureiro que se preza.

Visando aprimorar estas opções e preencher esta lacuna, trazemos aos jogadores de Old Dragon o maior suplemento de equipamento medieval já lançado no Brasil. Um enorme apanhado com mais de 650 equipamentos, animais, montarias, navios, propriedades, alimentos, roupas, insumos e até castelos.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Equipment in medieval games are important above the average of other genres. Living in a hole deep and dark, isolated from everything, in austere locations without any life not hostile nearby, part of the routine of every adventurer worth his salt.
For improving these options and fill this gap, to bring players from the biggest Dragon Old Supplement medieval equipment ever released in Brazil. A huge caught with more than 650 equipment, pets, mounts, ships, property, food, clothing, supplies and even castles.

128705.name: O Reino de Bruntoll
128705.description:
From publisher blurb:

O primeiro cenário do Old Dragon Fast Play está de volta, agora reescrito, revisto e ampliado! Em “O Reino de Bruntoll” você encontrará a descrição completa de um dos muitos reinos que compõem o mundo de Aymer; 26 deuses para seus clérigos; dezenas de organizações e PdMs; dicas para sua campanha old school; criação de personagens detalhada, incluindo a raça dos meio-elfos e muito mais. Tudo isso com um mínimo de regras e um máximo de ambientação.

Diferente dos cenários de campanha modernos, com centenas de páginas e descrições extensas, Bruntoll é direto, minimalista, para que você possa ler tudo rapidamente e já levar suas ideias para a mesa de jogo. Esse realmente é o seu mundo, pois permite uma customização imensa, deixando o cenário com o jeito do seu grupo, tornando os personagens dos jogadores as verdadeiras lendas por trás de tudo.

O Reino de Bruntoll segue as regras do Livro de Regras Básicas do Old Dragon, mas é totalmente compatível com qualquer sistema, incluindo o Fast Play Test. Mesmo as poucas regras apresentadas são encontradas em praticamente todos os sistemas de fantasia medieval.

Nestas páginas você encontrará:

A História de Aymer: da gênese aos dias de hoje;
Detalhes da vida comum e da geopolítica aymeriana;
Descrição completa de Bruntoll, o Reino Sob as Três Coroas;
Dezenas de PdMs e organizações;
26 deuses para seus clérigos;
Regras para meio-elfos;
Detalhes sobre as classes e raças;
Dicas para campanhas old school.






Translation courtesy of Google:The first scenario of the Old Dragon Fast Play is back, now rewritten, revised and expanded! In "The Kingdom of Bruntoll" you will find the complete description of one of the many kingdoms that make up the world of Aymer, 26 gods to his clergy, dozens of organizations and NPCs, tips for your old school campaign, detailed character creation, including race of half-elves and more. All this with minimal rules and maximum setting.
Unlike modern campaign settings, with hundreds of pages and extensive descriptions, Bruntoll is straightforward, minimalist, so you can read it quickly and now bring their ideas to the table game. This really is your world, because it allows a great customization, leaving the scene with the way your group, making the player characters the real legends behind it.

The Kingdom of Bruntoll follows the rules of the Book of Basics of Old Dragon, but is fully compatible with any system, including the Fast Play Test. Even the few rules given are found in virtually all systems of medieval fantasy.

In these pages you will find:

The Story of Aymer: the genesis of the present day;
Details of ordinary life and geopolitical aymeriana;
Bruntoll complete description of the Kingdom Under the Three Crowns;
Dozens of NPCs and organizations;
26 gods to their clergy;
Rules for half-elves;
Details about the classes and races;
Tips for old school campaigns.

128706.name: Manual Fast Play
128706.description:
From publisher blurb:

O manual básico do sistema Old Dragon com regras de evolução de personagens até o nível 5. Ideal para sessões de teste do sistema e para a introdução do RPG a pessoas alheias ao hobbie pela simplicidade e pela didática na explicação das mecânicas. Este manual contem praticamente todo o conteúdo da versão definitiva, para que a sua campanha não sofra qualquer tipo de reformulação quando seus personagens atingirem o nível 5.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The basic manual system Old Dragon with rules of evolution of characters up to level 5. Ideal for system test sessions and the introduction of the RPG to people outside the hobby by simplicity and didactic explanation of the mechanics. This manual contains most of the contents of the final version, that your campaign does not suffer any kind of reformulation when your characters reach level 5.

128707.name: Old Dragon Fast Play: Tabelas de Referência
128707.description:
From publisher blurb:

Este arquivo contém todas as tabelas do [Old Dragon Fast Play] para agilizar as consultas e a mediação de conflitos durante as partidas. Contém as tabelas de personagens, equipamentos, armas & armaduras, combate e listas de magias, tudo isso diagramado no formato A5, econômico e prático para ser encadernado em casa.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This file contains all the tables in Old Dragon Fast Play to streamline consultation and mediation of conflicts during the games. Contains tables of characters, equipment, weapons & armor, combat and spell lists, all diagrammed in A5 format, economical and practical to be bound at home.

128708.name: Pocket Dragon Manual de Bolso
128708.description:
From publisher blurb:

O manual de bolso do Pocket Dragon inclui a versão completa do sistema para impressão de modo que se forme um pequeno livreto pra levar na carteira.

O Pocket Dragon não inclui outros módulos para serem impressos. Você encontra TUDO o que precisa neste único arquivo (com exceção da ficha de personagem e de outros suplementos, é claro).

São todas as quatro classes, raças, regras de combate, com diferentes armaduras e armas, magias com lista de magias incluída e evolução de personagens.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The pocket manual of the Pocket Dragon includes the full version of the system for printing so that it forms a small booklet to carry in your wallet.
