Pocket Dragon does not include other modules to be printed. You will find EVERYTHING you need in this single file (with the exception of the character sheet and other supplements, of course).

are all four classes, races, rules of engagement with different armor and weapons, spells to spell list and included evolution of characters.

128709.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Quarriors! Quest of the Qladiator, the third expansion for Quarriors!, you have been selected to compete in the Qladitorial Games! Quadrennially, Empress Quiana calls together the mightiest Quarriors across the land to compete in the great Quolosseum. Will you defeat all other competitors for the greatest Glory?

Quarriors! Quest of the Qladiator adds forty new custom dice powering six new creatures and two new spells, in addition to a new "Lock" mechanism that allows some creatures to have long-lasting game effects.
128709.name: Quarriors! Quest of the Qladiator
boardgameexpansion: Quarriors! Key Master Lord of the Quarry Promo Card

128710.name: Vermes on Mars
128710.description:
Vermes on Mars is Aztlan Games’ new sci-fi shooter, which is available for iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad now.

Vermes on Mars is an action-laden 2d game with:


a multitude of very beautiful, procedurally generated levels,
an exciting and inspiring gameplay experience,
a unique and stunning visual look and feel,
a great soundscape and electronic-orchestral score, and
an excellent input scheme with a very nice touch!


In the year 2098 the Geologic Industry, the biggest corporate entity at that time, is the driving force behind the Mars resettlement project. The Martian soil turned out to be rich in valueable materials and thus became the key component in profit maximization process. Driven by the lust for fame and the desire for monetary increase, he Geologic Industry decided to send unmanned vehicles to harvest the precious elements, while the terraformation of the planet is still in progress. What seemed to be a stroll on easy street, quickly became a challenged when the first robots when landing on the planet were seized and destroyed by an alien lifeform… the Vermes on Mars!

In each level four unmanned intelligent vehicles are placed at the player’s disposal. The player is supposed to find and neutralize each worm that hides in the soil, while collecting the priced materials, which can be found on the terrain. The difficulty varies during the game and always delivers a challenging and entertaining experience. There are different species of worms on Mars, ranging from snappish sandworms to stampeding rockworms and scorching fireworms. Each of the player’s bots can be upgraded and can be replaced with more efficient vehicles while the game progresses.

Vermes on Mars is Aztlan Games’ second title after Multipods Escalation and is available now.

Source: The Game Website.

128711.name: Dragon Flight
128711.description:
Do you like fantasy or dragons? Or even flying? Are you done playing difficult and complicated games? Then this game is strongly recommended. New flying game nothing like other, DragonFlight.

Dragon Flight is a game that attacks enemies with powerful magic, which then allows you to move further beyond that space. Skill up your magic and use various items to survive from dangerous moments.

■ Register to the game center and compete your ranking scores with friends. Flying distance is not everything in this game. It's not everything to go far away. There is 2 types of ranking. There are lots of people in the world, however your friends will not be easy to defeat.

■ Easy control! Dragon Flight can easily be played by one hand grabbing the device and the thumb controlling the character. Does this make game so simple? No way! It might be easy to control but with diverse situations, it takes you into a great depth of excitement.

■ Only 5 second tutorial! Easy to install and quick to adjust. You can easily adapt to Dragon flight without a tutorial.

■ Both available for I-phone and I-pad. It supports Retina display, too. Let's see simple and pretty character with high definition quality.

■ Stay excited for new updates. Even though it's a free game new updates will be continuously uploaded. New update will provide a new tactics and new enjoyment.

Source: The Game Website.

128713.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Leviathans simulates combat between warships that have taken to the air in an alternate history/steampunk 1910. The king leviathans, battleships, are the largest vessels. Maneuvering in support are light cruisers, destroyers and other vessels. Will you captain your ﬂeet for king and country, expanding your nation's power and becoming legend? Or will you fall from the sky, forgotten? You determine the outcome!

Leviathans: British Fleet Box contains the British battleship, light cruiser, and two destroyer high-quality plastic ship miniatures from the Leviathans Core Box Set, but with four new, unique variant Ship Cards. Players can instantly expand their faction fleet after purchasing the Core Box Set for larger games.
128713.name: Leviathans: British Fleet Box

128714.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Leviathans simulates combat between warships that have taken to the air in an alternate history/steampunk 1910. The king leviathans, battleships, are the largest vessels. Maneuvering in support are light cruisers, destroyers and other vessels. Will you captain your ﬂeet for king and country, expanding your nation's power and becoming legend? Or will you fall from the sky, forgotten? You determine the outcome!

Leviathans: French Fleet Box contains the French battleship, light cruiser, and two destroyer high-quality plastic ship miniatures from the Leviathans Core Box Set, but with four new, unique variant Ship Cards. Players can instantly expand their faction fleet after purchasing the Core Box Set for larger games.
128714.name: Leviathans: French Fleet Box

128715.name: Become the Hunted
128715.description:
From the front page:
Become the Hunted
(King Cobra #1)
A 1-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 3.0 Scenario
VS03-SA03

by Carl Buehler

Someone has convinced elements of the UCAS military that the best way to combat freelance shadowrunners is with their peers. It's your job to show Major Black and Staff Sargent Sunday what you can do in a series of military exercises. No need to worry chummer, the military promises not to play rough even though medevac has been promised.

boardgamecompilation: Parsec Expansion Kit 1: Moons and Monsters
Parsec Expansion Kit 2: Nebulas and Nanotechs
128716.description:
After millennia of shifting dominant civilizations, wars and industrialization, Homeworld became a planet that couldn’t sustain its population... Off-world migration was the last hope. When your Homeworld is nearing its demise, it is time to saddle up your rocket ship and explore the neighborhood in nearby space.

PARSEC is a tile placement game of discovery and exploration in outer space for 2 to 4 players. Featuring easy mechanics and a nimble pace, Parsec is a truly teachable game for everyone. It boasts rich, compelling Euro-style competitive gameplay as each player races to improve their positions to garner the most points and technology progress between scoring rounds. Careful placement of drawn tiles featuring sections of planets, nebulae, asteroid fields, and more is half the game, while maneuvering your rocket and carefully assigning its compliment of robots for control of these key locations is equally important. Asteroids and a presence on opponent-dominated Planets garner Credits used to purchase additional actions. After the last Planet is completed, a final scoring round takes place and the winner determined.

This is your chance to save the denizens of Homeworld; explore PARSEC today!

Note: PARSEC DELUXE includes Parsec and its first two expansions: Moons and Monsters (#1), and Nebulas and Nanotechs (#2).

Game Data:
Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player commands a ship full of robots exploring the space around their declining homeworld
128716.name: PARSEC Deluxe

128717.name: Call of the Wild
128717.description:
From the front page:
Call of the Wild
A One-Round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure
by Wes Nicholson

Some jobs are hard, some are easy. Got to Amazonia, catch a few animals, bring 'em home, get paid. The Seattle Zoo is footing the bill and THIS time, your ID's are legit! What could go wrong?

128718.name: Defender Chronicles II: Heroes of Athelia
128718.description:
User Summary

Defender Chronicles II: Heroes of Athelia is a vertical, 2D Tower Defense game with strong RPG elements. Each map consists of paths that wind from the top of the level to the bottom, with enemies entering at one end and trying to reach the other. The player may establish "guilds" at predetermined positions on the map, and these guilds will support up to five units of the same type in that position. Unit types include crossbowmen, archers, warriors, mages, and more. Strategy and story are driven by the game's for Heroes: Melwyn, Lovell, General, and Elwyn. Only one hero can be taken into battle at a time. The hero is much stronger than a guild, and can provide various bonuses to particular unit types (for instance, Melwyn boosts the effectiveness of mages). Heroes gain experience when a stage is completed, and may allocate skill-points after a level-up. The player also earns credits that may be used to purchase equipment , which is a crucial part of the game design. Heroes may equip several accessories at a time, and loot has complex properties like many RPGs (Diablo etc). At the time of writing, Defender Chronicles II is not "free to play," but it does rely heavily on in-app purchases to generate revenue. Such purchases can permanently boost end-of-level experience and money, alter the rare-item drop rate, and so on. The developer for DCII maintains a web community for the game that can be accessed directly from the app itself.

128719.name: Pocket Dragon Livro de Monstros
128719.description:
From publisher blurb:

Este suplemento, um dos mais pedidos para a linha Pocket do Old Dragon, possui 24 criaturas de variados níveis de poder, com estatísticas totalmente convertidas para o sistema pocket.

De Goblin a Dragão, passando por Orcs e Trolls numa seleção clássica e ao mesmo tempo muito eclética de desafios para os seus jogadores e como não poderia deixar de ser, tudo numa única folha A4.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This supplement, one of the requests to the line of Old Pocket Dragon has 24 creatures of varying levels of power, with statistics for the system fully converted pocket.

From Goblin Dragon, through Orcs and Trolls in a classic selection while very eclectic challenges for your players and how it could not be all on one A4 sheet.

128720.name: Pocket Dragon Wuxia
128720.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wuxia é um suplemento para Pocket Dragon que busca uma forma simples mas divertida de usar elementos dos fantásticos filmes chineses (onde lutas com espadas em pleno ar e poderosos golpes de kung fu são comuns) em sua mesa de RPG.

Usando o sistema Pocket do Old Dragon, “Wuxia” é uma adaptação aberta do gênero, inspirada em filmes como “O Tigre e o Dragão” e “Herói” e buscando diversificar um pouco o tema do jogo.

Pegue sua Destino Verde ou seu Sabre Dragão e entre no mundo dos heróis errantes de Wuxia!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Wuxia is a supplement to Pocket Dragon seeking a simple but fun to use elements of the fantastic Chinese films (where sword fights in midair and powerful kung fu moves are common) on your desk RPG.

Using the system of the Old Pocket Dragon, "Wuxia" is an open fit the genre, inspired by movies like "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" and "Hero" and seeking to diversify a bit on the theme of the game.

Take your or your Destination Green Dragon Sabre and enter the world of heroes Wuxia wandering!

128721.description:
Axia — a land with a glorious past, a most uncertain present, and an even more unpredictable future. Populated by what has been described as a fervent and warm-blooded people, Axia is in crisis – economic, social, and political: the longest-running recession in its modern history, the highest inequality in years, and a political system teetering on the brink of collapse.

In more ways than one, Axia is fighting against itself. Old divisions of the past have given way to new ones, and this generation – along with the next ones – has the most to lose.

Will you, along with your fellow industrialists, do your part to help Axia? Will you sacrifice short-term gain in the present for a brighter future? Can you do that, and survive? Perhaps you can, and perhaps you can even thrive – and you will, if you see opportunity where others only see crisis!

CRISIS is a turn-based game for 1-5 players who assume the roles of businessmen, trying to rebuild their businesses and create value at a particularly challenging time. By skillfully placing their managers in a position to invest in companies, trade resources, and navigate the local bureaucracy and regulations, they can thrive and prosper in a time when others might struggle and decline.
128721.name: Crisis
boardgamepodcastepisode: 14. Devon Dice Podcast - Runemeet vs the Spiel Des Jahres Nominees
Episode 30: Imhotep Review + Question from a Hat
HLG 7: Op de foto
HLG 9: Essen in Zicht
Perfect Information Podcast Episode 31 - So this is Christmas...
The Polyhedron Collider Cast - UK Games Expo 2016
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 7

128722.name: Run Dave Runn
128722.description:
From the front page:
Dave's Not Here!
(Run Dave Runn)
A Two-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
VS02-CL08
by Rich Osterhout and Chris Jardon
Rewritten/Converted to 3rd Edition by Rich Osterhout

A man is supposed to be innocent until proven guilty. Your Johnson has been presumed guilty and has asked that you help prove his innocence. Did he do the crime or is he being framed as he claims? This scenario is Part 2 of a Two Round Scenario and is preceded by "See Dave Runn".

128723.name: A Espada Morcego
128723.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Muitos séculos atrás, uma poderosa espada fora criada para combater os invasores das terras bárbaras. Esta arma era conhecida como “Bianfu Jian”, a “Espada Morcego.”

A Espada Morcego é uma aventura idealizada para personagens de 2 a 3 níveis, que explora todas as vertentes e novidades apresentadas no [Pocket Dragon Wuxia] (download nesta página)!


Translation courtesy of Google:

"Many centuries ago, a mighty sword was created to fight the invaders from barbarian lands. This weapon was known as "Bianfu Jian", the "Sword Bat."

The Bat Sword is an adventure designed for characters levels 2-3, which explores all aspects and new features presented in Pocket Dragon Wuxia (download this page)!

128724.name: Lobo em pele de Cordeiro
128724.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Guilda dos Criadores de Galinhas de Kelt está com problemas! Suas galinhas estão desaparecendo, e pegadas no local indicam a possibilidade de um ataque de lobos.

Um dos membros da Guilda parece estar envolvido no caso, mas quem? “Lobo em Pele de Cordeiro” é uma aventura curta feita para exercitar as capacidades de investigação e interpretação de Jogadores e Mestres iniciantes, mas pode ser aproveitada por todos e facilmente adaptada a qualquer campanha e cenário.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The Guild Breeders Chickens Kelt is in trouble! Their chickens are disappearing, and footprints at the site indicate the possibility of an attack by wolves.

One member of the Guild seems to be involved in the case, but who? "Wolf in Sheep's Clothing" is a short adventure designed to exercise the capabilities of research and interpretation of Master Players and beginners, but can be enjoyed by everyone and easily adapted to any campaign and scenario.

128725.name: O Pequeno Ataque das Formigas Gigantes
128725.description:
From publisher blurb:

O pequeno vilarejo de Kinnfort passa por grandes problemas. Suas plantações estão sendo devoradas por formigas gigantes! Mas como afastá-las? Quem as trouxe pra cá? Alguém as trouxe pra cá?

Essas e outras perguntas aguardam por você, convocado para procurar as respostas! O Ataque das Formigas Gigantes possui uma estrutura estilo sandbox. Com poucos elementos fixos, permitindo ao mestre e aos jogadores total liberdade na condução dos acontecimentos e desafios!


Translation courtesy of Google:

The small village of Kinnfort has major problems. Their crops are being eaten by giant ants! But how to remove them? Who brought them here? Someone brought them here?

These and other questions await you, convened to look for the answers! Attack of the Giant Ants have a sandbox style structure. With few fixed elements, allowing the players to master and complete freedom in the conduct of events and challenges!

128726.name: Contos
128726.description:
From publisher blurb:

Contos é um web-suplemento para Shotgun Diairies que trás a tradução dos 4 contos originais do Shotgun Diaries. Eles podem ser usados como fonte de ideias para personagens, situações ou aventuras e são perfeitos para auxiliar na imersão da ambientação tensa e apavorante do Shotgun Diaries.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Tales is a web-Shotgun supplement Diairies back to the translation of the four original tales Shotgun Diaries. They can be used as a source of ideas for characters, situations or adventures and are perfect to aid in the immersion of the atmosphere tense and terrifying Shotgun Diaries.

128727.name: Dossiê Shotgun
128727.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine que um médico do CCD (Centro de Controle de Doenças) fizesse um último trabalho antes dos zumbis invadirem nosso mundo? Imagine que esse dossiê trouxesse uma nova forma de ver o mundo, lidar com propostas alternativas e que lhe dessem várias opções totalmente inovadoras. Agora imagine que esse dossiê é na verdade uma metáfora de um suplemento.

Esse é o "Dossiê Shotgun", um suplemento escrito como se fosse um relatório científico e que faz uma verdadeira devassa no sistema do Shotgun Diaries, lhe apresentando alternativas e acrescentando mecânicas que certamente vão mudar a sua forma de ver o jogo.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Imagine that a doctor's CCD (Center for Disease Control) to do one last job before the zombies invade our world? Imagine that this dossier bring a new way of seeing the world, dealing with alternative proposals and to give him several options totally innovative. Now imagine that this dossier is actually a metaphor for a supplement.

This is the "Dossier Shotgun", a supplement written as a scientific report and makes a real freak in the system of Shotgun Diaries, will present alternatives and that adding mechanical will certainly change your way of seeing the game.

128728.name: Fragmentos!
128728.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fragmentos é um web-suplemento para Shotgun Diairies que trás uma série de pequenos pedaços de diários de sobreviventes para lhe dar idéias para aventuras. Temas, cenários, acontecimentos em diversas partes do mundo para você usar como ponto de partida ou inspiração para as próprias histórias.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Fragments is a web-Shotgun supplement Diairies that brings a series of small pieces of daily survivors to give you ideas for adventures. Themes, scenes, events in different parts of the world for you to use as a starting point or inspiration for the stories themselves.

128729.name: Space Dragon Fast Play
128729.description:
From publisher blurb:

O manual fast-play do sistema Space Dragon com regras de evolução de personagens até o nível 3. Ideal para sessões de teste do sistema e para a introdução do RPG a pessoas alheias ao hobbie pela simplicidade e pela didática na explicação das mecânicas. Este manual contem praticamente todo o conteúdo da versão definitiva, excetuando algumas regras mais avançadas que só são encontradas no manual básico. Este livro é inteiramente ilustrado com imagens de "pulp comics" dos anos 30 e 40 para que você entre perfeitamente no clima de aventura e ação que o Space Dragon busca proporcionar!


Translation courtesy of Google:

The manual fast-play system with Space Dragon rules of evolution of characters up to level 3. Ideal for system test sessions and the introduction of the RPG to people outside the hobby by simplicity and didactic explanation of the mechanics. This manual contains most of the contents of the final version, except for some more advanced rules that are only found in the basic manual. This book is fully illustrated with images of "pulp comics" of 30 and 40 years for you to enter perfectly into the atmosphere of adventure and action that seeks to provide the Space Dragon!

128730.description:
Bump N Run is a roll and move style game played on an oval race track/game board with 3 racing lanes. each player rolls the dice to determine the starting order. Highest roller is 1st, next highest 2nd, and so on up to 8 players. Each player starts the game with 10 fuel tokens, 4 tire tokens,and 4 Bump n Run cards. Then you decided on how many laps to run(5,10,20,etc).

Each player, in turn rolls the dice and moves there car/pawn around the board space by space, lane to lane wherever they choose. Every time you roll the dice it cost you 1 fuel token, every time you change lanes it cost you 1 tire token. when you come up on another car/player you have the choice to race around him, or race to through him by playing a Bump R Run card, which knocks him back to where your turn started.

When you get low on fuel or tires you race in to the pits to spin the pit wheel to earn money to buy more fuel, tires, and Bump N Run cards. You spin the wheel once per turn and stay as many turns as you need to.

Every time you complete a lap of the track/board you collect a lap counter card to keep score. The first player to complete a pre-determined number of laps is the winner.
128730.name: Bump N Run the Stock Car Racing Board Game

128731.name: Game Geek (Issue 32- Aug 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Behind the Game - Rolling it Up
The Apartment, a Game of Urban Warfare
128731.description:
Musing of the Avalon Stogie
Behind the Game, HWM Sample builds
Coral Throne
GROMM
Avalon Pathfinder
Sorceress issue #1
Heroes Wear Masks, Carnival of Evil
Nova Blast
Avalon Models
Arcana
Reviews
Writers Toolbox, Formatting.
What's New

128732.name: None of the Above
128732.description:
In this trivia game, on your turn you will answer your question with 1 to 3 possible answers. The other players then vote using their cards whether the correct answer is #1, #2, #3, or "None of the Above." The active player gets 3-5 points if he's right, more points if he wrote fewer answers. The other players get 2 points if they guess correctly.

If players don't feel they can accurately guess, they can "cheat." They can look at the answer, get only 1 point that round, and must include the correct answer in the three they write on the board.

128733.description:
In 1894, farmers from the small village of Malpaso face the prospect of again losing their livelihood to a band of roving thieves, led by the self-styled "General" Mapache – himself wanted by the Mexican National Defense Army.

Their solution is to go to the much admired but fallen from grace "Padre" Esteban, and see whether he can hire gunfighters to protect them. After trying to raise funds by any means at the "All Rivers" Poker tournament, the Padre recruits a band of gunslingers for the task and, once complete, travels back to the village over the precipitous Los Quantos bridge – all the while harassed by a detachment of the General's men. There they fortify Malpaso itself, and usher the frightened villagers into the abandoned silver mine for protection.

When the bandits finally attack, both sides are prepared. Mapache's men unleashing their Gatling gun to devastating effect, while the villagers have a few tricks of their own. Both sides will suffer many casualties in the calamitous battle, but will the Mexican Army arrive in time to put an end to the bloodshed?

Revolver 2: Last Stand at Malpaso is a two-player card game set in the Old West, in which one player takes the role of General Mapache and his band of thieving outlaws, and the other player controls the villagers and guardians hired to protect the town of Malpaso, led by the infamous Padre Esteban. Each player has a unique deck of cards with unique possibilities as well as different winning conditions, which requires different tactics and different methods of play.

More than just new locations, Revolver 2 features brand new gameplay elements in players can use a mine cart-mounted Gatling gun, blow up a bridge, assemble their own team of gunfighters, and dynamite mine tunnels. The game also includes a terrific Stud Poker mini-game which determines in which town the initial firefights occur.

Like the original Revolver, the game remains elegantly simple and can be learned in five minutes. That said, Revolver 2 is a standalone game and the cards from Revolver and its expansions (red packaging) are not interchangable with Revolver 2 and its expansions (green packaging).
128733.name: Revolver 2: Last Stand at Malpaso
boardgamepodcastepisode: Lucky Podcast Number Seven ft. Leigh Alexander
OBG 97: Counter Active

128734.description:
Revolver: By the Gun They Died, is a promotional set of cards available at Spiel 2012, that can be used to customise the two different decks in Revolver. Between matches, the owner of a deck can draft new cards in for old, leaving each deck at 62 cards. The cards included in the set are:

Colonel McReady's deck:


Apache Warrior (5 copies)
"Set the train ablaze!"
Pony Express Relay Station
Ruined Chapel at El Ray
Herschel Papazian - Pinkerton Sharpshooter
Sefton Redshaw - Bounty Hunter
Clear Skies
Brady Logan
Elias Hooker
"Wriggler" Hooley and the Swain Boys


Jack Colty's deck:


Austin Granby - Railroad Engineer
"She's carryin' your grandchild!"
Banditos (5 copies)
Turkey Joe
Bullet: Vicious Mutt (alternate bandit)
Uncouple the Caboose
Buttermilk – Colty's Mustang
Robber's Roost (2 copies)
128734.name: Revolver: By the Gun They Died

128735.name: ZDAY Survival Simulator
128735.description:
User Summary

Designed by Ed Anderson and illustrated by Matt Haley.

ZDAY is a choose-your-own-style adventurer that starts you off at the beginning of a zombie apocalypse and forces you through a series of scenarios and choices to see how long you will live.

The game is presented primarily in text and starkly illustrated comic-book-style images. There are multiple pathways through the game, depending on the choices you make. And of course there are hordes of bloodthirsty zombies.

128736.name: The End
128736.description:
The End Begins!

The world comes to an end; run like hell, collect duct tape, and buy goodies for your survival camp. Once the streets are deserted, everything is covered in lava, and you are alone. Yet, you hear the call... and even in the middle of the Collapse, you know it is time to run, to survive!

Run!

The End App challenges your reflexes and offers infinite game play with progressive level design and multiple environments. Jump over the burned down police car and reach the hidden duct tape while running through the deserted city. You will be guided through 14 days with 5 challenges for each day. Practice with free-runs for a challenge or buy boosters to take the edge off, but never, ever take your eyes off the duct tape! Collect them!

Features

Awesome, diverse 3D graphics, with vivid, rich colors.
The hottest topic of 2012 told from a rare perspective, making the game unique and funny.
Unleash crazy Power Ups.
Experience multiple environments.
There is a huge city to explore, with more than 100 levels.
Infinite game play makes The End addictive.
Original music, sound effects, and cool voiceovers.
Compete with your friends through the Game Center Leader board.
Facebook and Twitter share integration.
Easy to use swipe and tilt controls
Experience high display graphics, even on older devices.
Native retina support at 60 FPS.




Source: The Game Website.

128737.name: Paper Train
128737.description:
One million player have chosen Paper Train (HD), and the long waited new levels have arrived!

PT: Master Edition has been developed with a lot of love and experience to entertain both the current and the future Paper Train fans!

Boost button is a new feature - while you are pushing it, the game runs faster and you get extra points.

The rules are simple: control railway traffic without crashing any trains.

Features:
- 100 maps (the first 10 is free)
- 4 difficulty levels
- boost button
- beautiful hand-drawn graphics
- you can play your own iPod music
- Game Center support
- universal app (supports iPad/iPhone/iPod)
- retina display support
- multitasking support

Source: The Game Website.

128738.name: Icarus-X
128738.description:
Full 3D Vertical Shooter
Simple and intuitive controls
Epic boss battles
4 Challenging Difficulties
Online Leaderboards
Downloadable Replays
Practice in slow motion
Achievements and Unlockables


Source: The Game Website.

128739.name: Towers N' Trolls
128739.description:
Defend your kingdom from invading troll hordes in Towers N’ Trolls, the addictive quick-to-learn but difficult-to-master Tower Defense game, combining fast-paced arcade action with quick-thinking strategy.

Towers N’ Trolls features beautifully hand-painted environments and playful, light-hearted monsters from the Age of Fantasy.

Build and upgrade your defenses strategically to keep the monsters from reaching your castles. Employ ballistas, catapults, cannons, ice and lightning towers, even exploding powder kegs and noxious gas clouds to stop the trolls! Towers N’ Trolls updates the Tower Defense mechanic with active gameplay to keep you engaged and at the edge of your seat! With multiple difficulty levels, you can enjoy the experience as you like it, from Casual mode to Brutal, depending on your threshold for pain.

Brought to you by the creators of the console hits, “Toy Soldiers” and “Baldur’s Gate: Dark Alliance”

Source: The Developer Website.

128740.name: Heineken The game
128740.description: The game can be played by 2 to 6 players. Goal of the game is to collect 6 Heineken stars as fast as possible. You collect a star by answering a question card right. The questions are about the history of the beer and about Heineken. That's how players learn about Heineken. The board is a worldmap. This is how players travel from continent to continent. To illustrate what kind of export product Heineken is. Heineken the game is educative, enervating and fast played!

128741.name: Diceathlon
128741.description:
Diceathlon - The Dice Decathlon

If you like other dice games like Yahtzee™ and Dice With Buddies, you're going to love this game.

With the 2012 Olympics just around the corner, get in training now. Play either on your own, with a friend, or with opponents from around the world, taking in turns to play the 10 events of the Diceathlon.

Score a low total in the 100m, a high total in the long jump and see how many hurdles you can clear in the 110m hurdles.

In a similar way to the Decathlon, scores are awarded for each event, based upon performance. The winner is the player who scores the highest total at the end of the 10 events.

FEATURES

Multiplayer dice game with unique game play;
Play on one device or across devices;
Turn based game, so you can play multiple games, against different opponents, at the same time;
Use gamecenter to play against friends or random players around the world;
Receive notifications when it's your turn to play an event;
Overall high score rankings via gamecenter;
Receive achievements for a perfect score in each of the events;
Play from your iPhone, iPad or iPod.




Diceathlon events include: 100m, Long Jump, Shot Put, High Jump, 400m, 100m Hurdles, Discus, Pole Vault, Javelin and 1500m.

Source: The Game Website.

128742.name: Infinite Sky
128742.description:
You have been called to the front lines to defend the skies against an endless onslaught of enemies.

Choose from up to our planes in order to face the challenges of exciting 3D dogfights and increasingly difficult boss battles.

Collect coins and complete missions to upgrade your plane and increase your ranking.

Are you skilled enough to face the challenges of the Infinite Sky.

Source: The Developer Website.

128743.name: Darkside
128743.description:
For 200 years we have been mining our solar system's asteroid belt in peace. All that changed the day the Krainian Empire invaded our outer territories. Take the controls of the Arklight X-52 and take the fight back to the enemy!

Darkside is a sci-fi based shoot'em'up in which you pilot your way around 100's of massive asteroids. Fly in and out of their dark sides as you battle a host of alien hostiles. Watch out for orbiting chunks of rock, blast them into oblivion before they destroy the mining colonies!

Darkside Features:

100's of fast paced levels packed with aliens.
Arcade, Missions & Survival game modes.
Fly around massive asteroids in glorious 3D.
Ten awesome power ups of mass destruction.




Source: The Developer Website.

128744.name: Shattered Star Player's Guide
128744.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Shattered Star Player’s Guide gives players all the spoiler-free information, inspiration, and new rules they’ll need to create characters prepared for delving into the adventure and intrigue of the Shattered Star Adventure Path.

Within, players of this campaign will find everything they need to create character backgrounds tied to personalities and events vital to Pathfinder Adventure Path’s exploration of some of the many ancient dungeons spread throughout Varisia, along with new campaign-specific traits to give bold adventurers the edge they’ll need to take on the strange and deadly threats faced in these dark places. This player’s guide also features a view of Magnimar at a glance, and an introduction to the Pathfinder Society, including rewards and resources of the organization.

Adventurers don't need to descend into the darkened depths unprepared! Gather your allies and let the Shattered Star Player's Guide start your trip into the thrill and danger of the Shattered Star Adventure Path.

128745.name: The Dead Heart of Xin
128745.description:
From the back of the book:

An Ancient Heart Beats Again!

The seven shards of the Shattered Star have been recovered, and the Pathfinders prepare a grand festival on Magnimar’s Irespan to celebrate this incredible achievement. The culmination of this celebration is to be the reassembly of the seven shards into the legendary Sihedron itself, rebuilt for the first time in over 10,000 years. But as the ritual to reforge the artifact is completed, ancient contingencies rumble to life, the dead heart of Thassilon begins to beat again, and all of Magnimar is put in terrible danger. With the power of the Sihedron on their side, the heroes take a stand against this risen evil—but will the aid of this ancient artifact be enough to save them all?

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path concludes the Shattered Star Adventure Path
and includes:


“The Dead Heart of Xin,” a Pathfinder RPG adventure for 15th-level characters, by Brandon Hodge.
Explorations of lost cities and confrontations with ancient evils to continue your Shattered Star campaign, by Adam Daigle.
A survey of the ancient rulers of Thassilon—all seven runelords detailed in one place, by Rob McCreary.
The madness-inducing conclusion of “Light of a Distant Star” in the Pathfinder’s Journal, by Bill Ward.
Four new monsters, by Dennis Baker, Adam Daigle, and Brandon Hodge.

128746.name: Shattered Star Poster Map Folio
128746.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Designed to compliment and enhance play of the Shattered Star Adventure Path, the three huge poster maps in this map folio are an invaluable aid for any campaign set in the frontier region of Varisia. Included in this folio are two huge player-friendly maps featuring the cities of Magnimar and Kaer-Maga, and a third illustrative map of Varisia presented as an in-world handout.

With gorgeous city maps and an overview of the most popular region in the Pathfinder campaign setting (site of the Rise of the Runelords, Curse of the Crimson Throne, Second Darkness, and Shattered Star Adventure Paths) these beautiful maps serve as a great resource for any Pathfinder campaign.

128747.name: Dungeoneer's Handbook
128747.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monsters and pitfalls standing between you and your destiny? Overcome the challenges of any ruin, crypt, or castle with Pathfinder Player Companion: Dungeoneer's Handbook.

This player-focused guide to lethal lairs and trap-laden labyrinths reveals a wealth of expert options and survival strategies to overcome the dangers of any dungeon. Get equipped with specialized dungeoneering gear, learn what to watch for with profiles on the most common traps and hazards, never be ambushed again with cunning archetypes and class options, and be prepared for any danger with a host of new spells, magic items, and more! Golarion's greatest explorers also reveal their most daring exploits, ingenious techniques, and the stories behind the Inner Sea region's most infamous dungeons—not to mention the incredible treasures that await within.

Head into the dungeon with Pathfinder Player Companion: Dungeoneer's Handbook and whatever you find within won't stand a chance.

Each monthly 32-page Pathfinder Player Companion contains several player-focused articles exploring the volume’s theme as well as short articles with innovative new rules for all types of characters, as well as traits to better anchor the player to the campaign.

128748.name: Doom Comes to Dustpawn
128748.description:
From the back of the book:

Invaders From Space!

When the iron mines that made Dustpawn so prosperous played out not long after the Goblinblood Wars of Isger ended, the city shifted its focus from mining to goat herding with quite a bit of success. Things have, as a result, been quiet and calm in Dustpawn for the past several years, but that quiet is shattered the night a strange falling star roars across the sky above town to crash somewhere in the hills several miles to the south. When several locals eager to find the fallen star and strip it of its ore go missing, it becomes apparent that whatever has fallen from the sky is much more than a mere meteorite. There are those in town who claim the falling star was in fact a ship, and now a strange malady is creeping through the townsfolk. Can the PCs discover the truth behind the falling star before doom comes to Dustpawn?

Written by Mike Welham, the 2012 winner of Paizo Publishing’s annual RPG Superstar contest—in which unpublished authors compete before a panel of celebrity game designers and legions of their peers for the chance to write a Pathfinder Module—Doom Comes to Dustpawn presents the players with a classic trope of 1950s sci-fi recast in the fantasy setting of the world of Golarion. Can the PCs save the town of Dustpawn from a menace from the darkest depths of space?

Doom Comes to Dustpawn is an adventure of investigation and cosmic horror for 9th-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world’s oldest RPG. This volume also contains a gazetteer of the town of Dustpawn and a brand-new monster template for a strange form of feral mutation, both of which can easily be integrated into any campaign setting.

128750.name: Astro-Nots
128750.description: This is a children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hillarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. This is the outer space themed game Astro-Nots. The mission is to rescue the Astro-Nots from the moon surface by lowering the arm of the space ship. A magnet on the end of the space ship lifted the "Nots". The game was started by pulling the alien monster (attached via string) to wind up the game. When the monster was pulled back the game, the round was over. From the box: "Save the Astro-Nots from the Angry Alien!"Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.

128751.name: Heroes & Capitols (fan expansion for Settlers of Catan)
128751.description: This is an expansion pack for one of the best selling games on the market today: one of discovery, settlement, & trade. This expansion takes the game to a deeper level by adding Ships, Heroes, Event Cards. It also contains a new upgrade component called Capitols. No longer does one simply settle. Now one conquers. Showcasing all original artwork and card ideas, this expansion stays true to the heart of the base game while revitalizing it. Each game takes on whole new dimensions and outcomes. Visit our Facebook page for more details! www.facebook.com/HEROESandCAPITOLS

128753.name: Soccer  Game
128753.description:
Year around soccer fun:

Comes with a game board, a set of dice,30 each of the following: Penalty Cards, Penalty Kick Cards and Corner Kick Cards

Object: Player with highest score wins

Designed for 2-4 players

Ages 4 and up

Players can lose the ball by landing on a pass blockers square, landing on a ball out of play square
landing on an offside square or by the results of a penalty card

Scoring Points can be accumulated by going completely around the board for 1 point or as a result of corner kicks or penalty kicks

First player to reach 20 points wins the game

128754.name: Haymaker! (Issue 59 - 2012)
128754.description:
User Summary

In this issue: An Extra Segment; A Closer Look; Filler - H2OME; Ad Nauseum; Filler - The USS Saratoga; Around the World in 6,912,000 Segments; Digressions: The Antikythera Mechanism; Filler - The Antikythera Mechanism; Pointless Champions; Power Point; The Sideshow; Surbrook’s Stuff!; Tiger's Tale; Filler - Sea Monsters; & Soliloquies.

128755.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Anihilator
128755.description:
Anihilator is most powerfull of Moloch machines - heavy, resilient and deadly. When it appears on the battlefield, everyone knows it is key battle for the machines.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128756.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Scar
128756.description:
Hegemony is made of tough guys. And Scar is most tough of them all. His presence motivates other gangers to act as if they were even tough.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128757.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Bun
128757.description:
Beer keg on his back, chainsaw in his hands - lets go slaughter some enemies!
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128758.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Machete
128758.description:
Machete everywhere brings his... ehm... machetes. No one can match him in hand to hand combat. He is also so tough, he ignores some wounds he gets.
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128759.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Gangers
128759.description:
Gang members that wander on the wastelands. Demoralized, they attack settlements and gas stations. They rob and kidnap. Brave only in a group.

This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128760.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony – Black Angels
128760.description:
Black Angels. Machine roar always means trouble. When you see Black Angels, you're in trouble. They are tough, merciless and cruel.
This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128761.description:
Defender is basic unit used by Moloch for convoy and guard purposes. They have great firepower and armor and, whats important, they are cheap. The price for this is almost complete lack of hand to hand combat abilities.

This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.
128761.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Defenders

128762.description:
Brain - without him machines are just pile of junk with some basic, ineffective algorithms. They need him to think for them, analize, create strategies.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.
128762.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Brain

128763.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Mechanic
128763.description:
This robot is absolute necessity on the battlefield. He is a medic, but in machine world that means much more than in our world. Not only can he fix "injuries", but also reanimate and bring back to battle unit that has been destroyed.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128764.description:
Hunter. The meat grinder. His algorithms are simple: get close to the enemy and chop him down.
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.
128764.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Hunter

128765.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Kasparov
128765.description:
Kasparov Combat Brain. Fearfull machine, build from principle that two is better than one. He acts like a Brain - without him machines are just pile of junk with some basic, ineffective algorithms. They need him to think for them, analyze, create strategies. But in contrast from regular Brain unit he himself is a deadly machine, well armed and armored.
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128766.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Hybrids
128766.description:
Hybrids are blasphemous mix of human and the machine. Just their look makes you shiver. They are strong, well armed units that can be used for large variety of tasks.

This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128767.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Spiders
128767.description:
Spiders are the nightmare dream of Outpost soldiers. Invisible enemy, mindless force controlled by a Brain walking far behind. They can cross any obstacle, walk through walls with great speed. And when they catch you they will drown you in rain of lead.
This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128768.name: Sesame Street Hunt, Chase, Swap and Race!
128768.description:
This is a Sesame Street board game from 1985 made by Milton Bradley. There were 4 collectible game pieces included in the game that were displayed in a clear open window on the game box.

Object: Be first to return to START with three cards belonging to your Sesame Street Characters

Game Pieces: 1 Game board, 4 Sesame Street Playing Pieces, 24 Playing Cards, 1 Die and One Playing Cup (blue)

Collectible Game Pieces include: Big Bird, Cookie Monster, Bert and Ernie

128769.name: Haymaker! (Issue 55 - 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Filler Page: The Great Crush “Monster Wreck”
Filler Page: The Missouri River Stern-Wheeler Far West
The Stuff Heroes are Made Of
128769.description:
User Summary

The Wild, Wild West Theme Issue

In this issue... Filler Page: The Great Crush “Monster Wreck”; An Extra Segment; Ad Nauseum; Around the World in 6,912,000 Segments; The Stuff Heroes are Made Of; Surbrook’s Stuff!; ‘TribMuse; & Soliloquies.

128770.description:
Step inside a classic video arcade side-scrolling space shooter. Earth is once again at the mercy of on-coming waves of alien attack ships. Luckily, you have the one vessel that can defend the earth from the onslaught. Equipped with your all-important blaster, destroy wave after wave of alien ships and defeat the "Boss" at the end of each level, until the earth is once again safe.

Each Level of Blaster Waves is made up of a "Waves Round" and a "Boss Round". In a Waves Round, the dual-use cards in the main deck are used to setup waves of aliens attacking the player's ship, and also give the player a hand of cards for blasting away at those aliens. The blaster value on the card played from the player's hand is used to remove aliens in the attacking waves. Once the waves have been dispatched, the Boss Round starts where the player has a back-and-forth match with the Boss alien – with the Boss taking an action based on a reveal "Boss Action" card, and the player responding. If the player is able to defeat the Boss, the next Level begins. The player wins the game after defeating the Boss on Level 5.

The game includes Health indicators and PowerUps, such as shields, missiles, bombs, Health improvements, and even a "Wingman".
128770.name: Blaster Waves

128771.name: Aluette
128771.description: Card game played in South-Western France using a latin-suited card deck. This is an easy trick taking game for 2 or 4 players in partnerships where there is no trump suit and no obligation to follow suit. The winner of a trick, is the person who plays the highest ranking card. In the case of a tie, the trick is set aside, and the winner of the next trick takes both tricks. The object of the standard game is to get the most tricks. This game becomes much more interesting by aiming alternatively to get the three of Diamonds, or to avoid getting the Jack of Spades, which can be difficult tasks considering that not all cards are dealt to the players.

128772.name: Three Tricks
128772.description:
Trick Taking game for 4 players using the standard 52-card deck. Each player tries to take three tricks to get a maximum score.
For 0,1,2,3,4,5,6,... tricks, the score will be -5,1,4,9,-4,-5,-6,... points are awarded, respectively.

As you can see, at least one player is to get 4 or more tricks, thus getting a negative points.

Three tricks is a simple fun game invented by Jun Kusaba (Zyun Kusaba).

128773.name: Dés magiques
128773.description:
There are two special dice and thirty-six cards in this game.
In his turn player rolls the dice:
The first die shows six topics: boat, house, sun, apple snail, butterfly. The second die shows six colors.

Player who first grabs the card with the correct topic and color get that card as a point.
Player with the most points after all cards are taken is the winner.

128774.name: Ordino Match
128774.description: Two players have shaped pieces with varied numbering. The player rolls special dice then, according to the visible faces, groups them together to form a coherent logical order or sequence on the gameboard, eg: "3-s": "a vertical box" "2 squares horizontal" etc. for score points.

128775.name: Ordino train
128775.description:
Players must lead their locomotive to ten destinations. The gratings are formed of sequences of 1 or 0. The special dice contain only 1 and 0. Player rolls the dice and if they show by example 1-1-0, you may follow paths that meet the combinations 0-1-1, 1-0-1 or 1-1-0.

One of the three dice additionally carries a red face and a green face, for placement of traffic lights to prevent enemy movement with red or to clear the way with green light.

Who go through all of his destinations first is the winner.

128776.name: Le Jeu de Loupio
128776.description:
The goal is to reach St. Jacques de Compostela in the way that collected the necessary assets: generosity, courage, resourcefulness, knowledge etc.

Basically the game is a race from Assisi to Compostela, witt rolling the dice, but with hazards on the way and rewards for virtues such as 'courage' 'generosity' and 'knowledge'.

Who reaches the finish first is the winner.

128779.description:
Conquest Tactics: Inferno includes forty new cards, encompassing all of the different card types in the Conquest Tactics base game, with five copies of every Troop, three of every Spell and Skill, two of every Base, and so on.

These cards give certain factions access to spell and skill types that they've never been able to use before, gives other factions new mechanisms that reinforce their existing strategies, and expands on each factions' existing upgrade trees for troops, in addition to including victory conditions and bases that allow for new strategies and new cross-faction deck combinations.

The Kickstarter for this expansion ended unsuccessfully on September 1, 2012, and it was not released. The developers stated a continued interest in releasing this expansion in June 2013, but there has been no further news.
128779.name: Conquest Tactics: Inferno

boardgameimplementation: Lords of the Sierra Madre (second edition)
boardgamehonor: 2012 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
128780.description:
Pax Porfiriana – Latin for "The Porfirian Peace" – refers to the 33-year reign of dictator Porfirio Díaz, who ruled Mexico with an iron hand until toppled by the 1910 Revolution.

As a rich businessman (Hacendado) in the turbulent pre-revolutionary borderlands of the U.S. and Mexico, players compete to build business empires of ranches, mines, rails, troops, and banks while subverting opponents with bandidos, Indians, and lawsuits. Each turn goes as follows:

1. Action Phase: Perform three actions, such as play new cards, get new cards from the market, speculate on cards in the market, buy land, or redeploy troops.
2. Discard Headlines: Remove any Headlines (i.e. cards with the Bull-Bear icon) that have reached the leftmost position in the Market.
3. Restore Market: Restore the Market to twelve cards.
4. Income Phase: Collect one gold per Income, Extortion, and Connection Cube in play. If Depression, pay one gold for each card in play (includes Partners and Enterprises in your Row, and all of your Troops).

Four "scoring" cards (Toppling) are in the game and their effect depends on the current form of government. The government can change if troops are played and as a result of other cards. The form of government also influences different production values of the game, such as how much mines produce. Players win by toppling Díaz, either by coup, succession, revolution, or annexation of Mexico by the U.S. If Díaz remains firmly seated at the end of the game, then the player with the most gold wins.

Pax Porfiriana includes 220 cards, but only fifty cards (along with ten for each player) are used in a game, so no two games will be the same!
128780.name: Pax Porfiriana
boardgamepodcastepisode: BW035 – Uli Blennemann
Dice Tower News 124 - April 22, 2013
DJ70: Pax Porfiriana (2012) Jim Gutt, Matt & Phil Eklund
Episode 23 - Unpub 6 and a Slew of New Hotness
Episode 61 -- Does it Sing When it Scales
Episode 87- Haspelknecht
Essen 2015 - Phil Eklund
ET64: Civilizaciones, Trompetas y Cordoba.
ET68: Los Tres Tenores: Porfirio, Gurney y Wallace
Guns, Dice, Butter Episode XIII: Jan 30, 2013
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
I've Been Diced! episode 51: The PrezCon 2014 edition
Podcast #104 - Juegos o juguetes
The Long View: Pax Porfiriana
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

128781.name: Le Retour de Crochet
128781.description:
The object of the game depends of the hero played by the child:
Peter Pan: save as many children or remove hook
Hook: capture a maximum number of children or remove Peter Pan

Each player will move one checker according to the illustration of the card he plays.
Depending on the clan he represents, he will try to bring this character of his hero or away from each other. It must reflect the specific character displacement (2, 4 or 8 possible directions, the right to capture another character or not).

To retrieve a child captured, only the Duel is possible only once per player per game. We then use all the cards of two players to do battle. When all cards have been played, the one possessing the highest number wins the Duel and the child may choose to switch sides.

The game ends when one of the following events:

Peter Pan is captured
Hook is captured
All the lost children are out of the game (as they were captured or saved)

128782.name: Super Mafia Land
128782.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Super Mario Bros..




User Summary

Super Mafia Land is a sidescroller in the mode of the early Mario games. It features characters similar to the original game but has been rethemed in the world of a kinder form of 'Mafia.' Protagonists can run and jump, as well as pick up and throw objects from the ground and enemies.
A host of groovy techno beats accompanies this game.

128783.name: Seven Spades
128783.description:
From Wikipedia
Seven Spades is a card game, apparently created by Johan Wästlund in 2002. It's similar to Bullshit in that bluffing plays a key role; however the game is more fast-paced and, arguably, more intense.

While originally intended for two players (which is still the best way to play it), any number of people can play.

The gameplay is simple. A deck of 52 cards is used. The dealer shuffles the deck and places it on the table face down. The player to the left of the dealer is the first to go - he picks up a card from the deck, taking care not to show it to anyone. Now he can either discard it on the table, face up, or declare it a spade and put it in front of him, face down. If the latter happened, any other player can, but is not obliged to, challenge the first player by opening the card. If it's not a spade (i.e. the player attempted bluff), the first player is out of the game; if it is a spade, the second player is out. When only one player is left, he is declared the winner; with two people playing, the winner will always be determined on the first challenge.

The only other way to win is to collect a pre-determined number of spades - seven spades in the two-player version. The last (seventh) spade has to be a real spade, and is put face up, not face down. The person to do this is declared the winner.

Anyone can challenge a person who claims to have a spade, but only immediately after the card is put down. When the next player picks up a card, you are no longer allowed to challenge the previous player. Only the last card a player put down can be challenged, not the other ones.

When more than two people are playing, the number of spades to collect is adjusted so that it's always possible to win without bluffing. With a single 52-card deck, the number of spades to collect is:

for 2 people: 7
for 3 people: 5
for 4 people: 4
for 5 people: 3

To increase the number of spades, or to allow more than five people to play, more than one deck can be used. The number of spades to collect is then multiplied by the number of decks used.

Optionally the following rule can be added when more than two people are playing: if a person challenges another player and proves him a liar, he gets a free turn. This promotes challenging and makes bluffing a bit more expensive.

128784.name: Pig Tail
128784.description:
Using the standard deck of cards, each player tries to have the fewest number of cards at the end of the game. All cards are spread out face-down in the middle of the game like the shape of "pig tail". Everyone starts with no cards in his/her hand. In your turn, you either flip a card or play a card from your hand. If it is different color and different number form the previous one, then it stays there. Otherwise you take all the face-up cards to your hand. The game is over when there is no face-down card in the middle of the table.

There are a lot of games with similar rules. This one is particularly strategic. As there are only 2 colors (black and red), you really want to time when you start decreasing the hand size. It is all about timing.

The game is strongly recommended for even number of players like 4 or 6. The game is nearly as good with 3 or 5.

128785.name: Kakkuri
128785.description:
This is a traditional game in Fukui-prefecuture, Japan using the variant of Hanafuda cards called "Komatsu-Fuda（小松札）". Each player tries to get rid of his/her hand of 6 cards. You can play as many card as you want in your turn provided they make the sequence continuing from the previous number. There are some other ways to play 2-3 cards of the same number at once. If you manage to play all 6 cards in one turn then you get double the game point.

The game only works with 7 players. If there are 8, then one person with a particular card sit out.

128786.name: Parity
128786.description: Parity is a trick taking game using the standard deck of cards. You get the number of points equal to the number of tricks you take. However, if the number of trick is odd, then your score is negative. Thus, for 0,1,2,3,4,5,... tricks, you get 0,-1,2,-3,4,-5,... points, respectively. Since there are 13 tricks, someone must have a negative score!

128787.description:
Originally titled "The Champions Project" and intended to be a set of cards based on the varied champions of the game, it was "re-branded" as "Saints and Sinners" in 2013 to reflect that not only were champions being honored, but also events and the community. For the first time in a decade HEG added new content to Deadlands: Doomtown allowing for, new play styles, new decks, and new strategies.

By creating new cards for use in decks, Saints and Sinners expands the vast Doomtown card base, and will continue to, creating new content to keep the game evolving and growing.

As a continuing project, the card base will continue to grow and evolve as new champions are crowned with a new Tournament system allowing for new champions, and special events each year!

Following the Weird Western themes of both Deadlands and Doowtown, Saints and Sinners is doing it's best to stay true to the original game and to honor the players.

"Saints and Sinners" is a continuing project by fan group "Harrowed Entertainment Group" that is dedicated to providing cards for the Champions who won after AEG stopped printing the game, and honoring the community.

They are not produced or sanctioned by Alderac Entertainment Group, Although permission was obtained from John Zinser to release them as fan cards.

The cards have been playtested and reviewed. All art is owned by the original artist and was produced for use by HEG.

For casual play, it is up to you and your opponent if you can use these cards or not. For Tournament play, it is up to the Tournament Organizer.
128787.name: Saints & Sinners
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

128788.name: Ice Weasels
128788.description:
Ice floes filled with frozen weasels float by, and you must carefully chip them apart, pull out the furry popsicles, and defrost them. Be on your toes, though, because you don't want to get stuck with frozen monsters or miss your chance to grab the prized weaseltonium particles!

The game begins with a line of cards face up, representing an ice floe. Most of the cards depict a weasel frozen in the ice. On your turn, you may either chip one end off the ice flow and tow it away (take a card from one end of the line) or split the ice floe (separate the cards into two separate lines). If you have collected a matching trio of frozen weasels, you may thaw them to take an extra turn and score more points.

More cards are laid out as the game progresses. Preference cards make particular weasels worth more or less, so part of the strategy is keeping the other players from getting varieties they like while forcing them to take monsters.

128789.name: New Super Mario Bros. 2
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
128789.description:
Trouble always seems to find its way to the Mushroom Kingdom! Just as Mario and Luigi go off on a coin hunt in the sky, their beloved Princess Peach is kidnapped by the dastardly Koopalings. The brothers have to venture through over 80 stages to rescue her, grabbing an endless deluge of coins across land, water, air, and snow along the way.

Mario's latest adventure is chock full of all the classic side-scrolling gameplay you've come to know and love, easy to jump into for any type of gamer. But what really makes it the gold standard in platforming fun is the true WEALTH of brand new features and gameplay elements.

Source: The Game Website.

128790.name: Fiery Gauntlet
128790.description:
From the Introduction:

Beyond the doors lies a peculiar kind of room. The corridor continues to cross it along it's long axis after a fashion. But instead of walls you find steep drops on either side, with only a few solid columns every few feet. Waves of oppressive heat waft of the molten rock blubbering a few feet below the gangway and its glow plunges the room into a hellish light. Narrow guard platforms line the long walls of the room separated from the central walkway by several feet of glowing molten rock.

128791.name: Grandfather's Rain
128791.description:
From publisher blurb:


A Shining Doom Has Come To Broketree....

The silver poison has come again. In the days when your grandfathers were young the poisonous eastern hills roared with thunder and sent streaks of gleaming filth down the Sweetwater River. Those who drank of it sickened, but what else were they to drink in this dry land? If a band of brave scouts had not discovered ancient purification filters in the ruins of an Old Terran laboratory, Broketree would surely have withered and died. The filters fell to pieces when your fathers were still boys, but by then the river flowed clean and pure once more.

Now the thunder has pealed again and the silver filth has come once more. The filters are broken and useless. New ones must be found, and quickly, before the enclave is too weak to survive. Yet rumors come from the north that the mud miners of Digger Springs grow sick as well- and what will they do if they find salvation before the warriors of Broketree can again bring grandfather's rain?

Grandfather's Rain is a free introductory adventure for the Other Dust old-school roleplaying game. Fully compatible with the award-winning and free Stars Without Number sci-fi game, Other Dust gives you the tools to build your own savage post-apocalyptic world of monstrous perils and desperate struggles. Within this adventure, you'll find...

Broketree, a post-apocalyptic farming village laced by poisonous family feuding and a lethally idealistic creed
Digger Springs, a mud-mining settlement founded to excavate the bones of a buried Old Terran suburb, and a place where Hell's lid sometimes flies off.
The Ashbrook Research Center, a "diagram map" ruin built as an example for new Other Dust gamemasters.
Random tables for quick loot and reward generation, and a layout that lets you keep your focus on the adventure without constantly checking the rulebook

128792.name: Mud Eaters:  Campaign in the Great War
128792.description:
Author blurb:

It is the year 1917. Fighting in Europe ceased in the trenches. You are a team of American grunts, recently sent to the front. For over a dozen days you've been residing in the trenches, a couple of hundreds meters from the Germans' positions. Between you and your enemy stretches a no man's land. It reminds you of a brown swamp, full of bomb craters and chaotically spread wire obstacles. Here and there stands a half-burnt tree - the last reminder of normality.

Life in trenches might be boring but it is also a fight for survival. Almost nothing happens during the day. Both sides cower in makeshift dugouts. From time to time, a hail of artillery missiles falls on the trenches or somewhere around them. Careless soldiers, showing themselves too much while leaning out of the trenches, become targets to snipers. Above the no man's land cruise planes and balloons - yours and the enemies' - patrolling the area and controlling the movement of the troops.

Day by day you wonder when the order of attack will be issued. Or when will the enemy decide to commence a massive attack.

The trenches come to life during the night - it is the time for rebuilding and repairing of the fortifications or for journeys into the no man's land to take captives or to replace the snipers.

128793.name: Growlanser 4: Wayfarer of Time
videogamehonor: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
128793.description:
User Summary

Growlanser Wayfarer of Time is the fourth game in CareerSoft's Growlanser series. The game features a stand alone story with no knowledge of past games needed. The game continues the series tradition of having artist Satoshi Urushihara creating the characters. The game features a Tactical RPG battle system that has you issuing move and attack orders on an overhead map. Battles have objectives to fulfill and story elements can change based on how battles go, dialogue choices, and based on your relationships with other characters.

The PSP release of Growlanser 4 added new NPC, faster load times, playable characters, endings, as well as many other bonus features.

128794.description:
Toulon 1793 is an operational level game covering the siege of Toulon, in the South of France, between 25 August and 21 December, 1793. It’s an area based system covering the entire campaign from the initial landing by Anglo-Spanish forces (at the invitation of the rebel Toulonnais) through to their evacuation of the town as their ships came under threat from the batteries of the previously unknown Napoleon Bonaparte.

Operation points are at the heart of the system and combined with an innovative combat, loss and movement system generate a vast number of decision points for the players. Chrome comes in the form of spies, gendarmes, multi-national forces (and associated cooperation issues), reconnaissance, variable reinforcements and much more. The game covers an area from Ollioules in the West to Sollies in the East and from Mount Farron in the North to Cap Cepet in the South.

NOW SHIPPING
128794.name: Toulon, 1793
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 65: Andy Loakes, designer of Toulon 1793
I've Been Diced! episode 68: Randy Lein (Legion Wargames) and Roger Miller (Revolution Games)

128795.name: Fipsen
128795.description:
Trick-taking game for mostly 4 players. It is played in Prisdorf, Germany area. Using 25 cards (A,10,K,Q,J,9,8,7 from non-Diamonds and 7 of Diamond), the game is played like an easy version of Skat.

For 4-player game, players are dealt 5 cards. Among the remaining 5 cards, 3 of them are not used and 2 of them are placed face down in the middle of the table. Each player bids the number of tricks they can take with their choice of the trump suit. The game value is equal to these number of tricks called. Each of the following causes to double the game value: by not using the face-down cards (Hand game), by choosing a diamond as a trump (called "Ruten" - notice that there is only one diamond card in the deck), or by bidding 5 (called Durch).

There are also some special bids. Kieker is like null and he can use all 5 face-down cards to exchange his hand. Siebener Fips is the case to have all four 7s and an Ace.

128797.name: Unusual Suspects: Guide to an Interrogation Session (Redesigned)
128797.description:
From publisher blurb:

SHOCK. ISOLATION. INTERROGATION.

Prepare Your players for nightmare adventure of their life.

Many times in a role-playing campaign or even single adventure, player characters (PCs) face justice enforcers. This usually is not a nice meeting as almost every game character did something against the law.

Of course, you can say “My group is clear like a Palladin’s heart”. But chivalric life of Palladin may be considered a crime in kingdoms dominated by chaos followers.

So, don’t worry - there are no “innocent” characters. There are only those, who were not interrogated properly.
This book is about methods of interrogation… And how to play out when your character gets arrested.
What is inside?

Tips how to make players feel isolated, hopeless and scared.
Methods of interrogation (forget about Good and Bad cop, everybody knows it).
Tips how to outnumber players

128798.name: Walls Can Talk: Castle Legends & Adventure Seeds (Redesigned)
128798.description:
From publisher blurb:

Walls Can Talk is a pack of legends and adventure ideas for every fantasy or horror RPG. You can use it in the way that suits You best.

Stories in this book can be used as a stand alone adventures or encounter ideas. They do not refer to any real castle. Similarities with living or dead people are just a coincidence.

Be aware - there are some drastic stories inside. So the book is dedicated for mature readers.

128799.description:
Psight refers to a collective of psychics founded by the gifted Clairvoyant known as The Seer. With the aid of a powerful Telepath (Psi-Guardian) she sought out others of various talents to swell their ranks. She organized them in preparation for a war she foresaw hundreds of years into the future. The Psight competed with each other to gain strength and to teach the future generations to use their abilities. This competition became known as Psight, after the order itself.

In Psight, each player takes on the role of a psychic within the order of Psight. The goal is to defeat your opponents using your various Powers, Memories, and Abilities. If you gain Dominance over a Domain, your road to victory may become easier, as your opponents will no longer be able to use any additional Powers, Memories, or Abilities from your Domain. However, plan your actions carefully, because one wrong move could easily spell defeat. With a well-planned strategy and a little luck, you can be the last psychic standing and claim victory!

Psight is a strategy card game designed for 2-4 players. The objective is to out think your opponent and be the last player with cards in your hand. It plays similar to many CCG's without the expense of constantly buying booster packs or individual cards. We strongly disbelieve in the pay-to-win gaming model so everything you need to play with up to 3 other friends or family members is included in the game!

Psight is also a color-blind gamer friendly game with the use of Domain names and symbols on every card in the game.
128799.name: Psight

128800.description:
Until Dawn is a solitaire card game in which you play as John Woods in an attempt to defend your small cabin from a zombie attack. With the help of your dog, Jasper, and a loaded shotgun, you must stave off the zombies attempting to breach the four entrances to the cabin, and survive until dawn.

Worse, Woods’ wife, Rebecca, is suffering from a zombie bite to the arm, and is doing everything in her power to keep from being overcome by the zombie infection.

Once the sun rises, the zombies disperse, and you can make your escape.

As John Woods, you can defend the cabin by building barricades, commanding Jasper to help, and using your limited supply of shotgun shells. When you have the chance, you can also help Rebecca treat her wound. You may do as many of these actions as you wish, but, when you choose to stop, the zombies will take as many turns as you did.

There are three types of zombies attacking the cabin, each represented by a different colored card. As the zombies attack, cards are drawn from the deck and placed at one of the four entrances to the cabin. Eventually, the zombies will gain enough strength to begin breaking in. If all four entrances are breached, you lose. Just before dawn, the zombies launch one final attack. If you survive this attack, the sun will finally rise and you can make your escape.

Until Dawn won Best Horror/Zombie/Monster Game and Best Artwork in the BGG 2012 PnP Contest. Thanks all who voted! All files are available on the Corvid Games website.
128800.name: Until Dawn

128803.description:
Many intrepid adventurers have explored the jungle searching for the fabled and mysterious Temple of the Feathered Serpent. Some brave souls, such as yourself, have even found it and entered, lured by the soft-whispered promise of great treasure. None have plundered its ever-changing hallways and escaped to tell the tale. Will you be the first?

Temple of the Feathered Serpent (TotFS) is a tile laying game where you you are trying to navigate the ever changing maze to escape an ancient temple. Watch out for the deadly jaguars and snakes. The monkeys might sneak up and steal your hard won treasures.
128803.name: Temple of the Feathered Serpent

128804.name: Nyckelringsrollspelet
128804.description:
User summary:

Nyckelringsrollspelet (The Keyring Role-playing Game) is a Swedish crowdfunded fantasy role-playing game. The game consists of small cards held together by a keyring. The game rules are inspired by Tunnels & Trolls and the Storytelling system.

128805.name: Milky Way
128805.description: Milky Way card game is a meditative set-making game with an emphasis on strategy and memory. By matching the terra cards' top borders (the seasons), left borders (elements) and centers (landscapes) - the card player can make sets to gain victory points. There are also cosmos cards which multiply the score for a particular set. Be careful: Not every cosmo card will offer positive points.

128806.name: Holy Runes
128806.description:
Fantastic and addictive game. 1-4 players. Normal game mode, map mode, and challenge mode.

Objective: Defeat gold dragon and conquer the magic land with holy runes.

Challenge mode: No map needed. Each player is level 4, and equips 6 runes and 6 scrolls randomly.

Brief Game Rules:
Beginning: each player chooses role card and its side (light or dark), and takes 1 rune and 1 scroll randomly. Next, put the pawn on the battle map (Wasteland-Start Cell) and is Level 1

Process: the active player rolls a dice and moves on the battle map from start cell to Boss cell to fight the boss. When passing Boss cell, the player may choose to challenge the boss or return to the Start cell. When winning the challenge, the player goes to the next map and upgrade one Level.

Battle with monster: player starts first. The player may choose to use ability, rune or scroll in each turn. Ability can only be used once each battle and may be played anytime; only 1 rune can be played in each turn, and tap the rune after its effect (taped rune cannot be used in the same battle unless returned to hand); only 1 scroll can be played in each turn, and remove the scroll from game after its effect. The monster attacks secondly. Choose a monster attack card each turn to activate monster action.

Battle with player: opposing side players can attack each other when their pawns placed in the same cell. Any player can challenge another player when the pawn placed in the Battle Field Cell. The attacker plays first. Each player may use ability, rune and scroll to attack the opponent.

Team with player: same side players can make team when their pawns placed in the same cell. When they attack monster as a team, monster uses the different monster attack card to each team member. When they are attacked by opposing side player, their team status is broken, and the opponent may choose to attack each team member separately.

Cool Factors:

Normal game mode, map mode, and challenge mode
Strategic battle with abilities, runes, and scrolls
Dark and Light camp, Team mode, and Battle Arena

128807.name: Wiz Poker
128807.description:
