Cool Factors:

-Handy and addictive game
-2 colors, wiz point and power cards
-Easy to start and highly strategic

Description:
Fantastic, fast and addictive game with your family and friends. 3-6 players. 54 wiz cards and 6 power cards.

Play all your cards as soon as possible to get points or chips!

Brief rules:
Each round, the first player plays first, and other players follow in order. The “Point Rules” can be applied whatever 1 card or more cards are played. When a player wins a round and takes the lead in a new round, the player may get the wiz points on the cards he just played and use the wiz points to play power card...

128808.name: Business Empire
128808.description:
Description:
Business Empire is designed based on economic, financial and management concept in real business world. It demonstrates how to accumulate wealth and develop wealth quotient.

Brief rules:

There are 3 phases in a player’s turn: the beginning phase, the operation phase and the ending phase.
1) The beginning phase: The active player can draw 1 card from top of the library. Then the player generates revenue and pays interest.
2) The operation phase: The active player can build assets; sell assets; borrow liability; refund liability; place deposit; use deposit, operation card and disaster card.
3) The ending phase: If the player has more than 8 cards in hand, the player should choose to discard extra cards.

Cool Factors:

Simulation to real business world
Disclose the secret to accumulate wealth
Easy to start and highly strategic

128809.name: Ice Rage
128809.description:
User Summary

Ice Rage is a hockey themed game. Your goal Is to beat your opponent in a 2 on 2 hockey match. The game feature 2 player game on the same device, lots of characters and 3 different levels of difficulty.

128810.name: Khet
128810.description:
"t's the game that combines lasers with classic strategy. Players alternate turns moving Egyptian-themed pieces having two, one or no mirrored surfaces. All four types of pieces (pharaoh, anubis, pyramid and scarab) can either move one square forward, back, left, right, or diagonal, or stay in the same square and rotate by a quarter twist. Each turn ends by firing the real laser diode built into each player's Sphinx piece. The laser beam bounces from mirror to mirror; if the beam strikes a non-mirrored surface on any piece, it is immediately removed from play. The ultimate goal is to illuminate your opponent's pharaoh, while shielding yours from harm!"

Source: The Game Website.

128811.name: Yams! A Game of Power and Glory in the South Pacific
128811.description:
A strategy card game for 2-4 players. Players take up the roles of island chieftains in the Trobriand Islands in the Southwestern Pacific in the 1890s; chieftains are competing to become the new Paramount Chief of the islands. Over the span of several harvest seasons they gather followers and land, harvest yams which serve as the currency of the islands, host dramatic feasts, organize trading expeditions and use magic and deception to undermine each other. The game ends when the cards run out and the winner is determined by a counting of "prestige points," which are acquired through having worker or yam plot cards (worth 1 point each), winning feast cards from other players (3 points each) or kula cards which represent the legendary pieces of jewelry acquired on trade expeditions (worth 5 points each).

Yams! is based on the ethnographic works of legendary anthropologist Bronislaw Malinowksi working in modern-day Papua New Guinea in the 1910s.

128813.name: Jagten på den Forsvundne Troldmand
128813.description:
From the front cover:
De officielle AD&D-Turnerings scenarier I + II ved
Viking-Con 4

Torben V. Ussing

'User summary:
The official AD&D-tournament scenarios I + II at Vinikg-Con 4.
The hunt for the lost Wizard. The title played on the danish title of "Raiders of the Lost Ark" (Jagten opå den forsvundne skat).

The scenario was published the year after it was used.

128814.name: Gangbusters
128814.description:
From the front page:
Gangbusters
A Shadowrun 3rd edition adventure for the RPGA Virtual Seattle Campaign
Written by Doug Smith

User summary:
A war between two gangs brings opportunity to Claudia and her runners. One of the gangs is being backed with nuyen, toys, and cyberware. The other wishes you to find out who the mysterious backer is and help level the playing field. The opportunity for exercising some of a runner's more energetic skills is high.

128815.name: Pathways (Issue 17 - Aug 2012)
rpgissuearticle: A12 - When the Ship Goes Down
Delve into the Secrets of the Inquisitor
Faces of the Tarnished Souk: Perfect Aneshka, Fate's Immaculate Blade
So What's The Tavern Like, Anyway?
The Ties That Bind: Druid Terrain Bond
128815.description:
From the publisher's website:

Articles by Michael Welham (Rpg Superstar and #30 Badges of Faith) Steven D. Russell (101 Not So Simple Templates), Crieighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press), Ron Lundeen (Ron Amok Games), Thomas LeBlanc (#30 Battle Standards), Will Myers (AdventureaWeek) David Paul (Pathways Editor-in-Chief, and Editor of the 101 Series). Including Cartography by Eric Blische (Adventure Quarterly #1). Also you will find the top products with reviews by Endzeitgeist, and an interview with Gary McBride (Way of the Wicked) of Fire Mountain Games.

128816.name: Over the Hump Airlift Campaign 1942-1945
128816.description:
"Over the Hump Airlift Campaign 1942-1945" is a simulation of the airlift to China in World War II. The simulation includes 58 pages of rules and procedures, scenarios, counter sheets, and map sections.

There are 16 scenarios beginning with an introductory basic scenario involving one China National Aviation Corporation DC-3 type aircraft flying a pioneering path-finding flight from Assam, India across the Himalayas to Kunming, China. The second scenario brings in the US Army Air Force using C-47 type aircraft in flying fuel to China for Doolittle's Raiders that they would have used to fly from China to India after the Raid on Tokyo in early 1942. Scenarios continue chronologically capturing highlights of the airlift campaign and introducing in succession: C-87, C-46, C-109, and finally C-54 type aircraft. The final scenario provides for as many as 500 aircraft in a one day maximum effort that occurred on August 1st, 1945 when the Air Transport Command India-China Division made over 1,000 sorties and delivered more than 5,000 tons of cargo to China in a single 24-hour period. Scenarios provide historical average daily tonnage for comparison of player performance in running airlift operations.

There are four counter sheets on 8-1/2 inch by 11-inch pages with each 1/2-inch by 1/2-inch counter representing a single aircraft with its flight characteristics printed on the counter. There are eight map pages on 8-1/2 inch by 11-inch pages that can be trimmed to form a map approximately 16 inches by 40 inches with representations of geographic locations, terrain, and altitude bands for flying aircraft counters from India to China and returning for another load. Various simulation tracks, such as the tonnage delivered, time clock, morale and efficiency, loss rate, and search and rescue level are included on the map sections. The map also includes loading and turn around boxes at the air fields for tracking aircraft as they land, load or turn around, complete loading or turn-around, are cleared for takeoff, and take off on their next flight.

The simulation is available as a free download and is fully contained in an Adobe Acrobat file that prints out on 58 pages of 8-1/2 by 11-inch paper. The simulation includes some probability driven aspects of airlift operations, and three or more 10-sided dice can be used for these purposes. No dice are provided, and players will need to provide dice or other means of generating random numbers.

The simulation is designed for solitaire play. More than one player can participate by dividing aircraft types among players or dividing operating bases among players.

128817.description:
In the distant future, Penguins dominate the earth in the east and west, fighting for the supremacy of the earth.

Play is a game for two players divided into attacker and defender.

Players are divided into military forces and King penguins Emperor penguins.

Against the attacking card, do the defense.
A successful attack, you'll earn points according to the card walls.
Defense side, you can return fire so as not to give point to the attacker.

Place the card in the middle of the field three walls.

Player, published from a select My first card of each other. It can be used as a card during a round reinforcements.
One of the card walls, place the card.
The attacking side, select the attack walls. And to publish the card.
Defense side, then defense to expose any of my card was placed.
Remove the card Once the defense to attack. However, if you can not defense, removing the only card the defender.
Once the attacker's card remains, walls have been breached.
The attacker, walls to expose the card when you win, you earn points on the back of the card.

When you are finished, play the next round.

Victory or defeat is as follows.
●If you won a ten point ahead of the chip within three rounds, is the victory of the attacking side.
●If the round is over 3, less than 10 point is a victory for the defender.
●During a round, three walls when you are exposed by the attack, the attacker's victory.
●If, during the round, three walls has not been published even one is a victory for the defender.
128817.name: Siege Penguins

128818.name: Casual Friday of the Dead
128818.description:
CFOTD is a light and humorous board game where you play an office worker during the zombie apocalypse. Maneuver your token through an office building besieged by the armies of the undead to be the first to rescue the CEO and lead him safely to the exit.

Players also control their own zombie that they use to hamper and hinder other players and event cards can help you, hinder you, or give you helpful items to help you win.

Based on zombie B-movie cliches CFOTD brings the campiness of low budget movies into the office.

128819.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Scope
128819.description:
One shot - one dead? Scope has made it his life motto. When he looks through his sniper scope at someone, the guy is already dead.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128820.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Recon
128820.description:
Recon. Always at first line, get everywhere before others. Well coordinated, well trained and deadly.


This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128821.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Dr Quinn
128821.description:
Toughest woman on the battlefield. Medic - best at sewing, best at saving lives. Gives hope to those who think there is no hope for them.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128822.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Lieutenant
128822.description:
Its not easy to to promoted to lieutenant. He commands a squad and he knows how to do it. Must be one of the best in his squad. His special rules allow to add additional reaction.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128823.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Captain Berg
128823.description:
Captain Berg survived more than most Outpost battalions did. He is used for special tasks, where everyone knows that Outpost is going down.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128824.name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Light Troopers
128824.description:
Light troopers is a cheap squad with one strong point: their carbines. Make sure they get good shooting position and keep enemies away.

This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128825.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Cyborgs
128825.description:
Cyborgs. Toughest of Borgo units. They have modified skeletons and muscles and augmentations that increase their stamina. That gives them superhuman ability to survive.
This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128826.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Claws
128826.description:
Claws. Strong and fast mutants fighting with implanted knives. Deadly in close combat. And their speed lets them to get to close combat before you say "Grenaade!"
This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128827.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Brick
128827.description:
Brick is natural born killer. Guy knows how to use his shotgun, and in need he gets his axe. He pours fear in hearts of his enemies and allies alike.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128828.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Bison
128828.description:
Mutations made Bison huge. Huge and strong. Now he carries everywhere heavy machine gun and sledgehammer. He is so tough that he ignores first wound he gets.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128829.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Muttis
128829.description:
Muttis are horrible creation of Moloch. Unnaturally grown muscles give him superhuman strength. They are made to be universal soldier - good at medium and close range, deadly in hand to hand combat.

This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128830.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Borgo Mutants – Spider
128830.description:
My hands are full. In case of Spider this sentence gets a new meaning. He has 4 hands - and each with something to hurt you. He is fast and can climb everywhere.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128831.name: Schweine Schwarte das Rennen
128831.description: The eternally hungry pig has gulped up the die – when the little piglets on the hunt for burgers race towards the finishing line, you must press the belly of the pig to learn how far you can move it. Three piglets per player participate in the race along the burger spots. In your turn you press the belly of the big pig, the die tumbles and rolls and when it stops you know how far you can move one of your piglets. When your piglet ends its move on a spot with another piglet already there, you send this piglet back to the start. If you are the first to have three piglets in your personal burger finish, you win.

128832.name: Know Trouble
128832.description:
Card game made as a promotional item for Dettol, a very popular disinfectand in Britain. The game is endorsed by the Child Accident Protection Trust.

The cards consists of pairs of cards. One of the pair warns of a danger and the other gives advice on how to avoid that danger.

Three games are described in the rules. Keeping Me Safe is the main game. The first player places a danger card face up. The next player checks her hand and plays the advice card on top of it (if she holds it). If not the next player looks, and so on. Once a pair has been completed, the next player lays a danger card and the game proceeds until one player has used all their cards. He/she is the winner.

The other two games are more traditional, Snap and Pairs, but both are a little more difficult because the two cards that match are not mirror images which would be more usual in games of Snap or Pairs.

128833.name: Dos Equis Scenario Pack
128833.description:
Advanced Squad Leader scenarios, produced by the Texas ASL Club as part of the 20th Anniversary edition of the Texas Team Tournament held this past June in Austin, Texas.

The scenario pack also goes by the name “Dos Equis XX Scenarios Especial” as shown on the front cover of the scenario pack.

The 20th Anniversary Scenario Pack contains 10 brand new scenarios designed for play with MMP’s Advanced Squad Leader game system, and is a limited production item. It contains the following scenarios:

TX1: Beware the Hare: 10 May 1944, Pugacheny, Romania. Designer: Pete Shelling

TX2: Last Gasp of the Wacht Am Rhein!: 1 January 1945, 30km North of the Ardennes. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX3: Ruined in a Day: 19 November 1942, NNW of Stalingrad. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX4: Corporal Punishment: 7 February 1943, Kharkov, Russia. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX5: Rush Hour: 2 September 1944, Martincourt, France. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX6: Tough Enough: 2 May 1944, Facuti, Romania. Designer: Pete Shelling

TX7: Hit and Run: 6 August 1944, South of Baranov, Poland. Designer: Dan Preston

TX8: House of Cards: 14 April 1945, Grünewalde, Germany. Designer: Dan Preston

TX9: Hell Freezes Over: 14 December 1941, Panovo, Russia. Designer: Dan Preston

TX10: The Middle of Nowhere: 6 March 1943, North of Losovaya, Russia. Designer: Dan Preston

128834.name: Player's Handbook (Pony Tales: Aspirations of Harmony)
128834.description:
The Player's Handbook covers character creation and combat resolution in the Pony Tales: Aspirations of Harmony roleplaying game.

From the opening to the Player's Handbook:

"We wanted to build a fresh system from scratch to capture the flavor and fun that calls people to adventure in Equestria; a magical land where people don't need to choose between a flavorful character and a powerful one. Pony Tales emphasises creativity and cooperation amongst the heroes through a hassle-free system that's built to be fun for both character creation and roleplaying. Hopefully you'll enjoy playing in the system as much as we did - and maybe it'll help get Luna out of the dumps."

128835.name: The Pony-Handler's Guide
128835.description:
The Ponyhandler's Guide covers monster control in the Pony Tales: Aspirations of Harmony roleplaying game.

From the opening to the Ponyhandler's Guide:

"Enclosed you'll find a few tips about how we do things in our own game, both in setting up challenges for the players and some of the elements unique to running an adventure in Equestria.

"I hope to hear from you soon,

"Princess Celestia."

128836.name: Das Fussball Quiz
128836.description:
Who scored the Wembley goal? How big is a playing field? How many times Germany was the world champion? Which famous singer was formerly goalkeeper for Real Madrid? Which player has been hindered by the collision with a moose on his international duty?
48 question cards offer interesting facts and curiosities about the most wonderful thing in the world:
Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most cards after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

128838.name: Memo Quarto 4 Albrecht Dürer
128838.description: A playful encounter with the painter Albrecht Durer, this memory version. 18 masterpieces of the famous Renaissance artist must be collected after the memory testing, but not in pairs, but in quartets. Each image was divided into four parts, the players will now add back together. First you need to find two matching parts, they are designed to be found later in the game a fitting part, this may be set to. The displayed works are presented in detail in the accompanying booklet.

128839.name: Das Prestel Kinder Kunstspiel 2
128839.description:
A second simpler version of Prestel's Art Game. Players learn the most beautiful masterpieces of art history in an entertaining way.

Turn the spinner, move on the game board. Each field represents a range of art and is associated with a task: do pantomime, describe paintings, answer the questions.
A sharp eye and a good memory is needed.
The winner is the first who has puzzled together all the parts of his painting.

128840.name: Dumpshock Datahaven (Issue 1 - Oct 2009)
128840.description:
User summary:

In this issue:
Small Awakenings by By Mark “Kerrang” Laramore
Tough Lessons by Fletcher “Flext” Kiehn
Interview with a Developer by Steven “Bull” Ratkovich
Runners Companion Addendum: Shapeshifters by John Dunn
Giving Form to Chaos by Joe “Method” Monfre
Expanded Training Rules by Deek
Prime Runners by Steven “Bull” Ratkovich
Screamsheet by Steven “Bull” Ratkovich, Richard “Chrome Tiger” Riessen, and Mike Wich
Reviews by Kendall “Kender” Jung & Jason “Jackal” Olmo
Dear Mr. Johnson by David Dashifen Kees
Advice from a Fixer by Ben “Fistandantilus 4.0” Burnett
Music MaveN by Andy “Ravenmuse” Faraci
The Black Market by Mark Babey, Daniel “Eidolon” Henson, Mark “Kerrang” Laramore, and Steven “Bull” Ratkovich
Intro to the CGL Demo Team by Stephen “Bishop” McQuillan

128841.name: Das tolle Spiel für Kinder
128841.description:
Simple rules - similar to Trivial Pursuit and some party games - roll the die, move Your game-piece and answer question. If Your answer is correct get the pie of that category. Categories are: Pantomix, What is wanted, Forbidden Words, True or false etc.

Collect piece of pie from each available category to win the game.

128842.name: Das Wissens-Quiz
128842.description: 1100 questions from eight areas of knowledge: arts and culture, history and politics, nature and environment, sports and games, general, technology and science, earth and sky, fairy tales and legends, you roll and pull, gets on the color fields a question from the corresponding Worth area, who answers correctly gets a chip and is to it again, who first collected a chip from every field of knowledge, wins.

128843.name: Electronic Wissens-Duell
128843.description:
Electronically assisted knowledge and reaction game. There are 24 panels on both sides of the display and variety of topics, from animals to ABC and sports equipment.
One player enters the code number of the card nad the question is answered. Both players simultaneously search for the perfect image and enter its number. Whoever answers correctly gets faster, the point. The display also shows the final score. Who won after an agreed number of tables the most games is the overall winner.

128844.name: Profilius
128844.description:
Quiz game with cards, 110 question and answer cards, and the areas of travel, transport, technology, nostalgia and motor sports. Dice is rolled and it shows the category from the card.
Player who answer correctly first gets the card.
If there are no more cards left, player who has collected the most cards is the winner.

Promotional game for Pirelli

128845.name: Rund Um's Rote Kreuz
128845.description:
Game with similar mechanism with Trivial Pursuit, the questions relate to the work and training with the Red Cross. 200 question cards with questions in 5 areas of knowledge, including general education.
Object of the game is to collect card from each category to win the game.

128846.name: Spiel des Wissens 2. Ergänzungspackung
128846.description:
Second expansion set for Spiel des Wissens/I.Q. 2000

Categories are general knowledge, fairy tales and stories, heroes and villains, word and language games, cartoons and television, animals, sports and games. Correct answers get the players from planet to planet to planet Galaxia,
Player who first reach the target wins the game.

128847.name: Spiel des Wissens planet erde
128847.description:
In this special edition of Spiel des Wissens, based on the BBC TV series and the film of the same name, players travel round our planet. To be able to travel the must be able to answer questions. In this edition questions come from a general category called Nature and from 6 special so called worlds – mountain world, jungle world, ice world, cave world, deep sea world and desert world. –

On each question cards questions are separated into an easy and a hard section, two in each section. At the start of the game players decide together who gets which difficulty level throughout the game. Before each question the player decides if wants to answer question 1 or question 2 on the card.

You roll the die, move and answer a question.

128848.name: Big Week
128848.description:
From the introduction
"This is a simulation game of US strategic bombing raids from England and Italy on 25 February 1944, the last day of the `Big Week' offensive. Two or three players or teams direct the actions of the opposing air forces as they seek to inflict more damage than they suffer in this attritional contest."

UB Bombers from England and Italy move steadly towards their German targets while the US fighters seek to keep then protected from German fighter attack. Simple machanics mean the game is easy to learn, but the differing ranges of the fighters and speed of the bombers mean planning ahead is required. Not knowing when the Germans may attack and cause the fighters to drop their fuel tanks, and so have to return home make this harder than it sounds.

128849.description:
From the introduction -
"This is a simulation game of the battle of the Korsun pocket in Ukraine in January and February 1944. Two players or teams direct the actions of the German and Soviet forces as they seek to capture or regain territory and to inflict losses on the opposing forces while minimising their own losses."

The Russians try to create a pocket, and then destroy the German forces, while the Germans sek to free their trapped comrades. Simple, but subtle mechanisms, reflect trade offs between all out attacks and greater losses, and the mobility of armoured units.
128849.name: Hell's Gate

128850.name: Angels One Five
128850.description:
From the introduction -

"This is a simple grand tactical simulation game of the interception of an escorted formation of multiengine daylight bombers during World War Two. Two players or teams direct the actions of the escorting and intercepting fighters as they seek to inflict losses on the opposing aircraft while minimising their own losses. In team play, each player controls one or more specific fighter units, depending on the number of players and the amount of time available."

The counters come in four different sizes, with each larger size corresponding to the next higher altitude band (hence giving an intuitive representation of height, since higher units appear closer and so larger from an overhead perspective).

One of the games in Philip Sabin's book "Simulating War", with counters and map downloadable from his website.

This game has now been published in a deluxe edition by Victory Point games, with full colour components and added historical scenarios.

128851.name: Quala
128851.description:
A card game that feels like a mix of Mille Bornes and Rummy.

Each player has a hand of 8 cards. Players take turns in order; a turn consists of:
1. draw a card
2. (optional) meld cards (face down), and/or change previous melds
3. discard a card.

The first card melded must always be a "start" card; followed by several number cards (forming one out of 5 legal combinations), and a "key" card as last card.
In addition, the game contains cards that mess with other players hands, or allow to claim a discarded card.

A round ends when one player has completed a combination (for example: start, two triplets, key). Each player gets points for the cards he melded. There are some ways to score bonus points.

The game is played in several rounds, until the score of one player reaches 35 points.

128852.name: Torture the RPG
128852.description:
Authors Blurb

Perhaps your party captured the spy and need to get information out of him quickly, or maybe your Player Character has been caught by a serial killer, and now the story calls for a scene of torture and information extraction. This product gives you the ability to "game" this scene of pain, blood and horror.

Torture the RPG is a game designed to allow you to play through the process of torturing a character in your story. Rather than fall back on a "Will vs Will" type resolution which many systems might suggest, this game allows for a number of scenes where the Torturer and the Victim can use their various resources to defeat their opponents goals.

The framework can also be used stand alone, or for a torture scene within any other game, so if Super Villains are trying to get the launch codes out of your Hero, or the Nazi's are putting the squeeze on your Airborne POW, you can use this product to play through that scene.

128853.name: Embers: Three Adventures for Survivors of the Fire
128853.description:
From the back of the book

THREE TALES OF ADVENTURE FROM AFTER THE END OF THE WORLD
In the aftermath of World War III, the actions of a heroic few can determine the fate of the human race. The three adventures inside this supplement for SURVIVORS OF THE FIRE put the characters in situations crucial to the survival of the Medicine River settlement!

FEMME O’ WAR

The most dangerous warlord of the Great Plains is a woman leading an army equipped with weapons of mass destruction – and she’s set her sights squarely on Medicine River!

NULL & VOID

A group of nihilist zealots is out to erase all knowledge of the world before the war! Can our heroes stop a madman’s plans to destroy one of the last archive libraries before it’s too late?

DOWN BY THE RIVERSIDE

With an epidemic threatening the entire population of Medicine River, the only hope is a cache of medical supplies deep inside territory claimed by the Bad River Outlaws!

AND THERE’S MORE!

- Two NEW character archetypes!
- Three NEW vehicle options!
- Two NEW weapons!
- And more excerpts from The Mansfield Chronicles!

This supplement of adventures for SURVIVORS OF THE FIRE requires a copy of the core rulebook to play.

128855.description:
In Pyramidion, each player plays an Egyptian foreman in charge of a resource supply for the gigantic construction site of the Cheops pyramid. On your turn, you activate sites and play cards in order to gain the biggest influence on these sites. Each foreman will use his contacts among merchants, negotiators and torturers (!) to supply boats located in major cities of Egypt. These boats will set sail in the direction of Giza only when full capacity is reached with the resources they require. The foreman who most effectively furnishes the construction site – the one who first obtains ten victory points – will be rewarded by the Pharaoh himself.

Pyramidion is both a strategic and tactical game, with some luck involved and a lot of player interaction. Are you going to thwart others – or focus on your own success?
128855.name: Pyramidion

128856.description:
In Captain Midnight’s Treasure, you take on the role of a pirate on a crew that has just returned from a very successful raid and now it’s time to divide the loot in typical pirate fashion, with dice!

Captain Midnight’s Treasure is a family friendly, easy to learn, fast paced dice game that provides for challenging strategic game decisions in a fun environment. This game will test your knowledge of odds and probabilities, as well as help you teach them to younger upcoming gamers, as you decide when to push your luck and roll again, or stay with what you have.

Game Play:
You have 5 dice and 3 rolls to get as much treasure as you can from the pot before everyone else does. The game starts off by rolling the dice to determine the Swabbie. After that each person rolls the dice, with the Swabbie going last, trying to get a Ship, Captain, and Crew, with the last two dice determining how much treasure you get.

But since you are pirates, it’s not going to be that easy! First, you have to make sure you get enough treasure to beat the Swabbie or else you have to pay him his dues. Then, certain rolls will cause you to lose your treasure or allow you to take treasure from other players, or even become Captain Midnight himself!

And of course the one with the most gold at the end wins!
128856.name: Captain Midnight's Treasure

128857.name: Dumpshock Datahaven (Issue 2 - Dec 2011)
128857.description:
From the Table of Content:

I. Cover: Ronin
II. Dumpshock Interface
III. Table of Contents & Credits
Introduction
Fiction: Duality
Hacker's Node
Prime Runners - Ronin
Alternate Rules for Miniatures
Fiction: Hard Life, Easy Streets
The Scan: Focus Puyallup Barrens
i. Introduction/Map
ii. Gangs
iii. Organized Crime
iv. Interesting Places
v. Contacts
vi. Black Market
vii. Scream Sheet
Review of Jack Point's This Old Drone
Interview with Mission Coordinator
Dumpshocked
Last Word

128859.name: I Only Want What's Mine
128859.description:
From the front page:

I Only Want What's Mine
A One-Round Shadowrun : Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
VS02-PL06
by Rich Osterhout
origional concept by Wes Nicholson

A Milk Run leads to future employment as the reputation of the characters is spread through the shadows, but being known on the streets is not always a good thing.

128860.name: Diggin Deep: World's Game
128860.description:
Welcome to the world of Diggin Deep: World’s Game, brought to you by Diggin Deep Sports. With this game, you should be able to re-create a match of soccer complete with all the decisions that the coach would make. You decide who to dress and who to scratch. You decide who to start and who to save as a substitute. You name the starting keeper. There are also plenty of ‘in game’ decisions to make. Do I take a shot from the scoring zone, or try to penetrate for a better scoring chance. If the game is tied late in the second half, do I play conservative, or do I play aggressive and go for the win? My star midfielder just collapsed due to heat exhaustion. How do I replace his offense? How do I replace his defense? Once you have a solid understanding of the cards, charts, and gameplay, you should be able to play a full regulation match in about thirty minutes.

The game is played using three ten sided dice and player cards that represent their abilities on the pitch. Some players can actually 'dig deep' in certain game situations to tilt the scales in their favor. It's all here as you attempt to bring glory to your squad.

128862.name: HOTPOT
128862.description:
INTRODUCTION:
HOTPOT is a brand-new board game app for all hotpot lovers! Newly designed rules! Newly designed cards! Newly designed artworks! Please support original design!

THEME:
This hotpot meal is free! Everyone can eat as much as possible. However, the food is limited, and the food placed by you in the hotpot maybe eaten by other players, so please place your food wisely!

OBJECTIVE:
To win the game, you must collect as many stars(scores) as possible. In each turn, player must put 1 to 3 food cards in the pot, the food cards in the pot are used to gain menu card. And the stars can only be collected by gaining the menu cards!

Features
• Simple Game to Play
• Concise Rules
• Originally Designed Artwork
• Cooperative Game
• Highly Interactive
• Opponents Vary from 1 to 3 Players
• Easy and Hard AI Level
• Support Retina Display
• Game Statistics
FREE version of HOTPOT
• No game statistics provided
• With advertisements
• Can only be played 20 times
Please buy the full version to support us if you like this game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

128863.name: The Passenger
128863.description:
From the front page:
The Passenger
A Shadowrun 2nd Edition Virtual Seattle scenario
by Wes Nicholson
With thanks to Chris Maxfield and Mark Somers

From the scenario:
Two days ago you were all summoned to Claudia's place for a job. She offered refreshmants of the non-alcoholic kind, so you knew this was going to be tough. But so far it hasn't been.
All you had to do was pick up some passengers from various places and tak them to Counsil Island. Claudia had passes for you all to get onto the Island for the next week, and she reminded you that no weapons of any kind are permitted on the island. None of you was tempted to test that out.

128864.name: Welcome to Virtual Seattle
128864.description:
'From the front cover:
Welcome to Virtual Seattle
A One-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 2.0 Scenario
by Rich Osterhout

You have left your previous life behind and entered the shadows. Now, your contacts have led you to Claudia Tyger, one of the finest fixers in Seattle. Before you can join her team of elite shadowrunners, however, she asks you to perform a task for her. An introduction to Virtual Seattle for new characters and players.

128865.name: Elven Blood
128865.description:
From the mission coordinator:

Elven Blood is a compilation of 5 Convention Mission Pack adventures that can be run as a mini-campaign. They start off in Seattle where the runners get mixed up in a power struggle with the Ancients, and then moves down to Portland in the Tir.

For now Elven Blood will be a limited print run at the convention, testing the waters to see how these do as a print product. We will have the adventures available in PDF though once convention season is over (since we're actively running these adventures at the cons).

From the back of the book:

BLOOD WILL OUT

Shadowrunners have a lot of rules, and each and every one of them can be overruled by the proper amount of nuyen. So when shadowrunners talk about “never trusting an elf,” that’s more of a bargaining position than anything else.

Luckily for them, some elves have plenty of scratch they can use as a persuasive tool. And for the tasks they have in front of them, they’re going to need it. There’s money waiting for runners if they’re willing to venture into elven territory and take on a host of odd jobs. Jobs like: Tracking down reagents from cranky critters. Messing around in the affairs of Tír royalty. Dealing with a number of different punks and thugs, none of whom like you. And intervening in a leadership challenge of the most powerful elven street gang there is.

Elven Blood is a compilation of five different Missions that have been written to premiere at summer conventions. They can, however, be played by anyone. Whether you’re playing at a con, in a game store, or in the comfort of your own home, Elven Blood has an adventure for you. Taking you from the mean streets of Seattle to the wild lands of Tír Tairngire, Elven Blood offers exciting and inventive adventures for all Shadowrun fans.

Elven Blood is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

128866.name: Don't Rest Your Hooves
128866.description:
user comment

Don't Rest Your Hooves is a fan-made supplment for the psychological roleplaying game Don't Rest Your Head, adapting the My Little Pony setting to the RPG.

From the introduction:

"One thought was all it took, that day. The day you looked down at your pristine hooves, at the colorful-but-glassy eyes and hollow grins of the Ponies around you. The day you asked the question that started all of this. Maybe it was "why am I here?" or "how does this all work?" or even "What am I doing this for?" but what it did was open your eyes. It made you realize something terrible, something awful.

"In this paradise, where all needs are taken care of, where everything is beautiful and just, and everything is just so saccharine... in this paradise, you simply aren't happy to just go along with things anymore.

"That's when you started to notice things. The way all the other Ponies just drifted without a paying attention to the world, trotting like zombies. The way things always seem to work out for the better and go back to they way they were as if the problem never happened in the first place. The world operates on a disconnect with reality that you can't help but find ultimately disconcerting. Stuff seems to happen not because it should or because it makes sense but because it ought to, and you seem to be the only Pony that finds this troubling.

"Voicing these worries to your fellow Ponies got you nothing but confusion and concern... and the vague feeling that maybe you'd be better off forgetting about these little delusions of yours and rejoining the herd."

128867.name: Montezuma's Lost Treasure
128867.description:
In this daring game of adventure, you race through the twisting maze of Montezuma's Treasury collecting artifacts as you attempt to reach the Treasure room.

But beware, each tile you or an opponent lay can twist your path and lead you away from the Treasure. Each tile may reward you with an artifact, but chances are they are laced with deadly hazards that your opponents can trigger through drafting an Event card; crushing walls, pits, spikes, trap doors, shooting arrows, rotating rooms, and a boulder that rolls across the board.

Using your action points, pick up items in your adventure to help navigate past these hazards. Scramble through secret passageways, fight off dangerous creatures, activate secret doors and find your way through pitch black rooms. That map you found might be of help, but chances are the path behind you will cave in.

Even if you can't make it to the Treasure room you might have enough to win if you were able to collect enough Items with treasure points or Artifacts that are scattered throughout the Treasury.

For every hidden door you open, boulder that rolls through the maze, crushing walls that close, spikes that rise, trap door that opens you are impacting another area of the map as you move those tokens to a new area of the map. This might buy you enough time to find an exit with your arms full of riches. First one out watches the Treasury collapse from the inside out, chasing out or trapping everyone else inside!

Balance the Item cards you'll need to get out with the treasure you need to win, because the player that makes it out alive with the most treasure points in their hand wins!



Each players turn consists of 3 steps:
(1) Draft one Event card.
Event cards include triggering specific hazards on tiles (i.e. Arrows, Spikes, Rotating a room, Secret passageways)
and attacking other players through Thieves, Spiders and Rats event cards.(2) Perform 2 of the following actions
Move, Move, Take Item (cards), Play Item card, Rest (raise health by 1), take Treasure cards when in the treasure room

(3) Place new map tiles adjacent to the tiles your token is on.

Game Components


1 Board
12 Artifact Cards
20 Event Cards (12 unique)
38 Treasure Cards
51 Item Cards (10 unique)
1 Die to resolve conflict
4 Player Adventure Markers
4 Player Health Markers
1 Bag
Rules



90 Map Tiles
1 Treasure Room tile
3 Raised Spikes Tokens
4 Door Tokens
2 Open Trap Door Tokens
1 Boulder Token
1 Crushing Wall Token

128868.name: Wasted Colony
128868.description:
Guide a small group of survivors through the zombie apocalypse.
An entire city has been taken over by zombies and the player has to defend the last safehouse.
Pick a leader. Send out your settlers in the city to search for survivors, resources or information.
Produce weapons and traps. Repel the zombie waves and search for a cure to safe the city.

Source: The Developer Website.

128869.name: Hind Commander: Urban Creatures
128869.description:
Hind Commander: Urban Creatures (HCUC) is a Solitaire- or up to 4-Player cooperative game from Robert J. FRITZ inspired by the miniature game "Hind Commander" by Marcin Gerkowics (Assault Publishing). The Player/s fly combat helicopters and have to eliminate a creature (according to the given scenario) before more than 50 % of the concerned town has been destroyed by the creature.
The game is basically designed for a miniature tournament game at the Game Festival 2012 in Vienna which will be played there on the 18th of November for the first time publicly. After that event the rules will be published via Assault Publishing.
The game itself is limited on a set of rules and combines different materials which have to be obtained separately. To play it you need the following components:
- One set of rules and the necessary dice (1xD6 and 1xD10 or custom made die with arrows)
- 2 to 4 1/600 combat helicopters from the "Hind Commander" game system
- at least one 4D-Cityscape-Puzzle - more info on http://4dcityscape.com/ - (each scenario uses a different town and creature)
- different kinds of mini creatures (mini dinos and movie monsters) without any bases (you find product proposals in the rules)

128870.name: Zombie in Your Pocket
128870.description:
In Zombie in Your Pocket, a cooperative game for 1-4 players, players start in separate areas, fending off zombies and trying to find their friends. As they progress through a house, a hospital, a warehouse, or other locations, they find important items, fight zombies, and (perhaps) suffer terrible death. Once everyone has found each other, they meet in the graveyard and make their way to bury the evil totem to win the game.

Reimplements:

Zombie in my Pocket – solo version
Zombie in my Pocket – 1-8 player competitive version

128871.name: RPG Review (Issue 16 - Jun 2012)
128871.description:
From the publisher:


Interview with Marc Miller, author and designer of Traveller
Eclipse Phase Review and Character
A | State Review and Character
Dark Heresy Review
Traveller : Over Veil Review
Space Opera Retrospective Review
Ringworld and BRP Root/Branch Skills Elaborated
Mass Effecting the Thousand Suns
Jorune to Savage World Conversion Notes
Diaspora Tech Levels
T&T Planet of the Apes
Computer Game Reviews, Industry News, and Prometheus Review

128872.name: X
128872.description:
From the front cover:
XA Two-Round Shadowrun: Virtual Seattle 3.0 Scenario
by Matthew Phillips, Rich Osterhout, et al.
X ('eks) n. 1. the 24th letter in the English alphabet. 2. the Roman cardunal number represention for ten 3. an unknown quantity. X means many things to many people - what will it mean for you?

User summary:
The final adventure in the Virtual Seattle campaign. Run at GenCon 2003.

The adventure consist of two PDF-files:
The adventure (36 pages)
Appendices & handouts (29 pages)

128873.name: Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul
128873.description:
From publisher blurb:


Superhero Role-Playing is About to Get More Super!

Ever wanted to tell your own comicbook stories, but possibly you lacked artistic ability? Capes, Cowls & Villains Foul is a comicbook toolkit, allowing you and one or more friends to tell your own tales of heroism and sacrifice, superpowers and masked crusaders! Designed from the ground up to emulate the narrative style of comicbooks, CC&VF is a game for comicbook-loving gaming fans.

Create your own heroes using “building blocks” called Traits, ensuring that the characters act, perform and feel like actual comicbook characters.
Link your powers together in awesome and creative ways.
Be empowered the same way that comic book artists and writers are when creating comics.
Create villains of all types that will prove to be more than worthy adversaries for even the most powerful heroes. No longer will non-combat-oriented masterminds be inferior foes to those who are more physically imposing!
Whip up awesome C-List villains who continually plague and get the better of A-list heroes (until the end of the Issue).
Your brash archer no longer needs to stand on the sidelines nickel-and-diming the cosmic despot while your allies wallop him with their super-strength.
Fast-paced and descriptive action wherein damage is an abstract concept that can represent not just physical pain, but also frustration, exhaustion or simply being trapped.
Villains designed to effective both solo and as a team. The rules ensure that villains are scalable threats for heroes of all power levels.
Might your character develop rainbow powers for just one issue? Or perhaps your powered-armored hero just happens to have a specialized suit of “arctic” armor that’ll be helpful for an excursion in Antarctica. Or how about a hero whose comic has a new writer that alters his capabilities? All this is a big part of the game!
Live-action rules!
Team-ups of different “power level” characters encouraged and fun for all!
Character complications embraced as a way to enrich your stories and empower rather than cripple your characters.
Plug-and-play character templates ready to be customized, getting you in the action right away!
A lengthy example-of-play section showcasing the flexibility of the system.
Two short Issues to get your crusade for justice started!
More than two dozen heroes and villains!

128874.name: Batman (Arcade)
128874.description:
Batman is a horizontally scrolling beat 'em up arcade game released by Atari Games in 1990, produced by Numega. Batman must save Gotham City from The Joker. The storyline is based on the 1989 movie of the same name. It features stages based on locations in the film, including stages with the Batmobile and the Batwing. The game features realistic sounds and voices from the movie. The soundtrack is based on Danny Elfman's score from the film.

Batman has various weapons, such as batarangs and gas grenades at his disposal, as he takes on various goons and The Joker himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Batman (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

128875.name: Sushi Tower
128875.description:
Sushi Tower is a Japanese toy-style game where players take turns stacking sushi plates on a revolving platform. As the stack of plates grows ever taller, the tower becomes more and more unstable. When the tower falls during a player's turn, they must pay for all the plates in the tower.

The game includes three plates of three different colors. White plates are worth 100 yen and are the most stable plate. Pink plates are worith 200 yen and have bottom that cause the pink plates to lean a bit. Blue plates are worth 300 yen and have an off-center bottom, which causes the blue plates to be the most unstable.

The last person with money wins the game!

128876.name: Rover
128876.description:
The board contains 61 hexes of which 5 are black, 6 red (R) and 6 blue (B). The group of hexes is called the red player's base and contains the red player’s counters at the start of the game, similarly for the blue hexes. The black hexes are impassable. They can neither be stopped on nor passed through.

The game is won when the opponent’s base is completely occupied. This may be at any time after each player has had his first turn. Although the 6 occupying pieces are normally all of your own colour this does not have to be the case. If your opponent is foolish enough to leave a piece in his base then take advantage of it!

Players take it in turn to move any one of their pieces which is not in the opponent’s base. This piece is moved in any direction of the player’s choice until blocked by a black hex, the edge of the board or a piece of either colour. A piece must be moved as far as possible in the chosen direction—it cannot stop ‘en route’. At no time can a piece occupy the same hex as, or pass over, any other piece of either colour. A player must make a move on his turn. If he is unable to do so then he has lost the game. Once a piece has stopped on the opponent's base it may not be moved later but must stay where it is for the rest of the game. There is no penalty for moving through the opponent’s base, provided you do not stop there.

128877.name: Nähdään Kellon Alla
128877.description:
This is a trivia game about Finland's capital city Helsinki. There is 8 categories of questions: Restaurants & Nightlife, Culture & Sports, History, Streets & Places, Buildings & Statues, Companies & Institutions, Outside Helsinki and Infrastructure & Nature.

Every player chooses different starting place/category. You can choose one of eight categories and that means that you have one more question of chosen category than other categories.

All question cards have hard and easy question. If you choose hard question and you got it right then you get to next place and you can go on. If you choose easy question and you got it right then you get to next place, but your turn is over. If you answer is not right, you won't get forward.

Winner is the first player to get "Under the Clock". "Nähdään kellon alla" means See you under the clock. This "clock" is famous meeting point in the Helsinki.

128878.name: Jack Attack
128878.description:
Jack Attack is a platform action video game for the Commodore 16, Commodore Plus/4, and Commodore 64. It was published in 1983 by Commodore International for the North American and European markets.

This video game is simple to play and comes with 64 levels. Each level is laid out in a rectangular grid. The levels contain the player character, eight enemies, and a varying arrangement of bricks. The player's goal is to kill all the enemies without being killed by them.

The player character is able to push and pull bricks, which the player must use to kill the enemies. An enemy can be killed by being crushed either by the player character or a brick falling down on it or horizontally between two bricks. On the other hand, the player character dies if a brick or an enemy falls on top of it. Enemies are unable to push or pull bricks. Some levels include water, which is fatal to the player character, but safe to enemies.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jack Attack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Online play (jave emulator): http://www.vizzed.com/play/jack-attack-c64-online-commodore-...

128879.name: Rifts Black Market
rpgissuearticle: Experience Tables – Official source material for Rifts Black Market Sourcebook and Vampire Kingdoms
128879.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Black Market is the most prevalent trader in weapons, magic items, drugs, and contraband outlawed by the Coalition. Explore the day to day business of the North American Black Market along with its smuggling routes, practices, policies and notable nefarious products and services. Learn about the five major Black Market factions in North America and foreign groups like the Yakuza, Green Scarf Sect and the Underground Railroads of Atlantis and the Vampire Kingdoms.

Many Black Market O.C.C.s.
The Five Black Market factions that wield the greatest power in North America: Bandito Arms, The Chicago Network, The Immaterial Hand, El Oculta, and Le Marche Noir.
Black Market internal operations and security.
Black Market services, products, practices and customers.
More equipment from Bandito Arms and specialized smuggling gear.
A wide range of Big Bore weapons and other merc weapons.
Black Market criminal assignments, jobs and mercenary bounties.
Major Black Market smuggling corridors and routes through Coalition territory.
Smuggling methods, both magical and conventional.
Traveling Shows: Freak Shows, Medicine Shows and Circuses.
Traveling Shows as fronts for the Black Market.
Traveling Black Market Merchants, Market Towns and Market Outlets.
How the Coalition States deals with organized crime, and information on the Coalition prison system and border security.

128880.name: Toilet Kids
128880.description:
User Description

Toilet Kids is an overhead shoot-'em-up in the tradition of 1942. You play as a little boy who gets sucked down the toilet into a world where you must fly on your toilet shooting lasers and dodging fecal projectiles.

128881.name: Legendary Axe II
128881.description:
User Summary

Legendary Axe II is the sequel to TG-16's popular The Legendary Axe. Despite the title, swords are more prominently featured as weapons than axes in the game. Aside from fighting enemies, you also have to make some jumps and find items.

boardgameimplementation: The Resistance: Hidden Agenda & Hostile Intent
boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2013 Guldbrikken Special Jury Prize Winner
128882.description:
The Resistance: Avalon pits the forces of Good and Evil in a battle to control the future of civilization. Arthur represents the future of Britain, a promise of prosperity and honor, yet hidden among his brave warriors are Mordred's unscrupulous minions. These forces of evil are few in number but have knowledge of each other and remain hidden from all but one of Arthur's servants. Merlin alone knows the agents of evil, but he must speak of this only in riddles. If his true identity is discovered, all will be lost.

The Resistance: Avalon is a standalone game, and while The Resistance is not required to play, the games are compatible and can be combined.
128882.name: The Resistance: Avalon
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
boardgamepodcastepisode: Awakening The Uwe
Board2Death Podcast Episode 5 - Introductions Round One
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 001
Diogenes Digital 2x20: El Rey Arturo I
Dukes of Dice Podcast - Ep. 07 - Dwarven Traitors
EP31：EX咖喱棒
Episode 16 - Party Time
Episode Twenty-Nine: It Took Us 30 Minutes To Explain This To Dick
ET53: Los Hombres Lobos del bosque de Aguirre han robado un Van Gogh
HLG 13: Terugblik op 2016
NJAGP Episode 27 part 2:Totally Confused Again
Podcast EP13 – Suggestions de cadeaux de Noël
TGT 008: Social Games
The Dice Section 27: Social Games
The Fourth Ever SU&SD Podcast
The Good, The Board, and The Ugly Episode 5: “God does not play dice” -Albert Einstein
The One About Prezcon

128883.description:
The Manhattan Project: Second Stage consists of four small expansions that can be added to the base game individually or together.


Nations 2 works like the previous Nations expansion, with each player getting one card to represent a country and gain a special power. Seven new countries and powers are represented.



Rocket Technology allows you to build a rocket factory when taking the "Design Bomb" action. Rockets work exactly like bombers - but fighters provide no defense against them.



H-Bomb Technology upgrades the "Design Bomb" action, allowing a player to return an available bomb to the bottom of the deck in order to acquire an H-Bomb card. To build an H-Bomb, however, the player needs Lithium Deuteride, which comes from new cards that work similar to Mines.



Personalities adds seven roles to the game based on real individuals who contributed to the Manhattan Project. Each time you retrieve your workers you will select a different role. Each role will grant you persistent benefits until the next time you retrieve.
128883.name: The Manhattan Project: Second Stage
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 3: Explosief Materiaal
The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special

128884.name: InQuest (Issue 2 - Jun 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Card Stock - Who knows what the future holds?
If Today is Tuesday, This Must Be Area 51
My Deck is Better than Your Deck!
Swan Song - The Future of Gaming
128884.description:
From the Front Cover:


Price Guide for: Magic, Illuminati, Star Trek, and more!
Win a killer Magic deck!


InQuest: The Future of Gaming

Inside the mind of Anson Maddocks!
Magic: The Djinn Efreet War!
The Illuminati revealed!

128885.description:
Blockers! The Card Game recreates the Blockers! board game with similar gameplay but new goals. Instead of a 9x9 grid, players will now play onto a 4x4 grid, with 16 victory cards comprising the spaces of that grid. Frame cards surround this grid to label the rows (A-D), columns (1-4) and 2x2 regions (labeled with card suits).

On a turn, a player plays a "hand" card that specifies a row, column or 2x2 region and claims one victory card in the appropriate location. (Alternatively, a player can use a kicker card as a joker.) Each time you claim a victory card after the first one, the card must match the color or shape on the victory card that you claimed the previous turn. Once all players pass, the round ends and empty spaces on the board are refilled with victory cards. When the victory card deck is exhausted, the game ends and the player with the most victory cards wins.

Reimplements:

Blockers!
128885.name: Blockers! The Card Game

128886.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Chemist
128886.description:
Chemist. World Champion in creating grenades on the go. If you need smoke cover take him with you.
Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128887.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Preacher
128887.description:
Preacher is the voice of heavens brought to US. When words fail he turns to his shotgun. He gives your gang ability to reroll failed tests.
Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128888.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Cowboy
128888.description:
Cowboy. Texas toughest. Can shoot two guns with closed eyes. Two really big guns...

Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128889.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Messenger
128889.description:
Messenger - nothing can stop him. He knows every shortcut, appears and disappears in seconds. Fast and furious - thats Messenger.
Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128890.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Hired Gun
128890.description:
Hired Gun. He knows his destiny - who pays gives orders. Well trained - knows how to use his shotgun. Always settles his debts. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128891.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Bodyguard
128891.description:
Bodyguard. Nice guy when you want to feel safe. He protects one chosen character in your team and gives him bonuses to rolls. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128892.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Rat
128892.description:
Rat. Nobody pays attention to him. Can move not being seen. He is so cheap that your enemy will not want to waste his bullets on him. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128893.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Gladiator
128893.description:
Gladiator. Battle-hardened with countless arena fights. Unmatched in close combat. Knows every trick and technique. In his hands everything becomes a deadly weapon. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128894.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Fixer
128894.description:
Fixer - jack of all trades. When he is around you don't have to worry about weapon jam. He can also make holes in walls so that you'll never get into a trap you can't get out of. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128895.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Assasin
128895.description:
Assasin. Hidden and deadly. Impossible to track down. Perfect sniper. Gives you bonus for every enemy he kills. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128896.name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Thief
128896.description:
Thief - agile as a cat. No obstacle can stop him. He moves without noise. Can surprise enemy and sell them bullet in their back. Can also get cash from wherever your opponent has hidden it. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

128897.name: Chromebook 1 to 4 Conversions
128897.description:
From the authors website:

This book has Shadowrun game stats for 99.9% of all gear, weapons, chips, programs, vehicles, cyberware, and nearly everything else from all four Chromebooks (for Cyberpunk 2020), plus a few new sample characters thrown in as a bonus. You'll need to buy the Chromebooks to really use the conversions.

Edition: Second & Third

Even if you own the earlier Chromebook Conversions, this book is worth the download, as it has game statistics for use with Virtual Realities 2.0, Cybertechnology, Rigger 2, and Shadowrun, Third Edition as well as stats for use with earlier rulebooks! Also included are updates for the Plastic Warriors books Running Gear, Tech Specs, Project: 3, and Paranoid Animals of North America!

boardgamehonor: 2012 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2013 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
128898.description:
Nieuw Amsterdam was founded by the Dutch West Indies Company in order to encourage the lucrative beaver pelt trade with the local Native American hunters along the Hudson River. To establish a trading post there, they needed a town and a fort, which was built on the tip of Manhattan Island. To encourage European patrons – that is, settlers of means or noble birth – to populate the colony, they granted them both land and indentured servants. The patrons became the lords of a new feudal system not unlike that seen in Europe.

In Nieuw Amsterdam, players are those patrons, and they bid on action lots in order to build businesses, work land for both food and building materials, compete in elections, ship furs to the Old World, and trade with the Lenape Indians – a process that gets more complicated as players claim more land and push the Lenape camps farther up the Hudson River.
128898.name: New Amsterdam
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
Podcast #13: The Tale of Elfblow Whistleknife

128899.name: Schafköpfchen
128899.description:
Schafköpfchen is an easy variation of Schafkopf, a trick-taking game popular in Austria and Bavaria. In each of the four colors of cards in the deck are six cards numbered 1-6; the deck also contains gray cards numbered 7-15, which are always trump. An additional trump color is determined each round by die roll.

Each round, a player starts with eight cards in hand. The starting player plays a card, and the others have to follow the suit, if possible. The player with the higest card of the played color or a trump gets the trick. After eight tricks, players look at the cards they collected. Some of the cards show flowers, and the player with the most flowers scores 1 point.

The first player to collect 3 points wins.

128900.name: Die Vogelhochzeit
128900.description:
Objective: Be the first moving up to field 50
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued on cover inside.
remarks:
published before WWII

128901.name: Die tolle Drehscheibe
128901.description:
Objective: be the first moving your 3 meeples into target zone
- moving by turns -
throw the die and move according rolled number;
you need a '6' to step out and a '6' for an additional move;
target zone can be reached passing the turntable only;
if a meeple blocks/sits on a 'D' space turntable may be moved;
you may jump over other meeples, but your own one blocks you.
remarks:
published before/during WWII

128902.name: August 2012: The Living Dead
128902.description:
From Introduction:

Under many Outbreak Scenarios, one bite from a zombie can signal the beginning of the end. However, certain strains of the virus allow a character to make use of their remaining time. A character can associate themselves with those that are likewise infected to make use of their remaining time. They are occasionally marked and live apart from the rest of the Stronghold, or choose voluntary exile. They may undertake special missions on behalf of the Stronghold in order to make the best use of their remaining time.

128903.name: Falling Scales Chapter One
128903.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Darkness is terrifying, broken place. It has all of the problems and tragedies of our own, familiar world, but monsters also lurk in the shadows. Their presence makes the world more dangerous in a plethora of ways. Some of the supernatural beings prey on people in a literal sense — vampires drink the blood of the unwary, for instance, and crazed beasts hunt down people for their flesh. But other such beings simply make the world unsafe. They wage their secret wars and claim their territories and they all seek to keep the unknowing masses out.

Knowledge is like water. It seeks to escape. It finds its own level. It seeps into everything, and no matter how well-maintained the secret, someone eventually learns it. In the soul of every living being in the world is the potential to know, to become part of this secret. And now, one brilliant woman has decided that the world can no longer afford to be ignorant.

Falling Scales is the first installment in a multi-part chronicle. While these stories are meant to build on one another, they are also written so as to be useful and playable on their own. The only book necessary to run Falling Scales is the World of Darkness Rulebook. If your troupe wishes to play through this story using characters from one of the other World of Darkness games (or even a mix of several!), information for doing so is provided.

128904.name: Falling Scales Chapter Two
128904.description:
From publisher blurb:

For centuries, terrors have existed just outside our understanding. The public may know or even suspect creatures of the night exist, but millions have managed to go on with their lives, focusing on the mundane, the safe. We’ve passed off the truth as a child’s fairy tale or the ramblings of crazed lunatics. We’ve ignored the reality
in order to survive.

Thanks to the actions of the passionate few, we can no longer pretend the supernatural does not exist.

Now, perfectly ordinary people question what they see, what they hear, what they feel. They’re confused, lost, and lonely. They’ve turned toward their leaders to help them find a way out of the darkness, but they need a shepherd, a guide who is not afraid. They’ve found one: a powerful politician who believes society should open their eyes to the truth, that the supernatural takes many forms and the only way to defend society is to wage all-out war.

Falling Scales 2 is the the second and final installment in a multi-part chronicle. While these stories are meant to build on one another, they are also written so as to be useful and playable on their own. The only book necessary to run Falling Scales 2 is the World of Darkness Rulebook. If your troupe wishes to play through this story using characters from one of the other World of Darkness games (or even a mix of several!), information for doing so is provided.

128906.name: No Speed Limit
128906.description: It's everyone's turn ALL the time in this high speed domino game for all ages. To start, one tile is placed in the playing area. The other tiles are dealt out to the players. Someone calls out, "No Speed Limit!" and the action starts as everyone attempts to match tiles from their hand to tiles on the table. Every time a player places a tile down, more possibilities open up. Be the first player to get rid of all of your tiles and win!

128907.name: Storm 1995
128907.description:
A boardgame that is based on the real Operation Storm, from 1995, when the Croatian army liberated Knin from the Serbian-Chetnik aggressor. This game is shows the heroic Operation Storm in a educational way so that the heroic acts of Croatian soldiers may never be forgotten.

The game is meant for 4 players, and each one has its figure and throws the dice. Depending on the dice result, player takes over the fields on the board, and the start position is in the area of Croatian Kostajnica. All along the line where Croatian army passed are drawn tanks aswell as Croatian soldiers and Serbian-Chetnik occupators. The winner is the first one that liberates the city of Knin. There is a pamphlet with real-life historical facts about Operation Storm.

By this educational and fun system the goal of this boardgame is to commemorate the heroism of the Croatian Armed Forces during the Operation Storm, and may it never be forgotten.

128908.name: Griffeys' Dice Ball "The show" Baseball Game
128908.description:
Select your teams from 24 possible line ups or create your own team. Simply roll the dice and look up the results for each players AB. Players of the era are featured. Along with Ken Griffey guys like Sammy Sosa, Kirby Puckett, Andre Dawson, Lenny Dykstra and Wade Boggs are on the rosters.
Game comes with a score book similar to one that you might get at the stadium to list the play-by-play results of a game.
For youngsters there is also direction on how to calculate a players Batting Average.

128909.name: Norge Rundt
128909.description:
This is a Family game with a mix of questions about Norwegian geography, history and culture.
Every Player are to visit 16 random towns/villages, and have to plan their own route and try to be the first to return to their "home town".
You move around by throwing dice, and there are little twists like ferry that you either have to have a ticket for or throw a 1 or 5 on the dice to pass. and you can also get plane-tickets which makes it easier to get from one end to the other quick if you are lucky.
in most games getting a 6 on the dice is good, but here you have to answer a trivia question, and if you manage to answer the question-card tells you how many places you can move.
if you're lucky(?) you can go through the whole game without having to answer an actual trivia question.

it's a good game for the whole family, but I would recommend from ages 10 and up. it's a better game if players are on more equal terms.

128910.name: Pyramid Raiders
128910.description:
Pyramid Raiders is a light back-stabbing strategy game for 3-6 players. Players are treasure hunters looking for fame and fortune in a long forgotten pyramid. With the help of their special equipment, they will compete with each other to gather the most treasure from this expedition – but watch out for The Guardian! He awakes from the darkness of the ruins to fulfill his mission, to chase all intruders and throw them out with a curse!

In Pyramid Raiders, players lay down action tiles to move and collect treasure tokens on a hexagonal map. Besides providing a number for movement, action tiles will also effect The Guardian in different ways, such as rotate him to face another direction or make him move faster. Used action tiles will stay on board, and will be returned to hand only every five turns when they are all used.

The Guardian's movement is guided by a set of rules and does not need a player to act as the GM. Each turn after all players have finished their moves, roll a die to move The Guardian, then move it extra spaces depending on the action tiles played this turn.

At the start of each game, randomly place 49 treasure tokens of seven kinds on the map. Players score by collecting tokens of different colors, or by specializing in only one or two colors. Twelve wooden tokens are placed on the map as obstacles, and can be placed in different layouts to change the difficulty of the game. Ten item tiles are included to provide rule-bending effects for players. And for those who are up for the challenge, two extra Line of Sight tokens will let The Guardian literally grow eyes on his back, making it even harder to escape – or easier to trap other players depending on your point of view...

128912.description:
This card will be made available by Gary Games.

From the Card:

Moon Staff
Cost: 4 Runes to acquire
Lifebound Construct
Once per turn, you may spend 4 Runes to double your Power.
128912.name: Ascension: Storm of Souls – Moon Staff Promo

128913.description:
This card will be made available by Gary Games.

From the Card:

Cobra, the Sordid
Cost: 7 Runes to aquire
Void Hero
Gain 3 Power. The next time you defeat a Monster this turn, you may take it's Honor reward from the player with the most Honor instead of from the Honor pool. Choose one in case of ties.
128913.name: Ascension: Storm of Souls – Cobra, the Sordid Promo

128914.name: Ashen Stars Demo Game
128914.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stowaway is a new 20-minute demo for Ashen Stars from ENnie Award presenter and all around nice guy, Kevin Kulp. This demo premiered at GenCon [2011] to rave reviews. It’s a great introduction to Ashen Stars and includes six pre-gens.

From Demo Goal:

Your job is to give new players a fast 20 minute experience that feels like the best part of Star Trek, Firefly and Aliens put together. This requires a cinematic demo that stays rules light, even as it explores the game’s major mechanics and themes. A quick game like this gives the player the cinematic feel of ‘holy crap we’re all going to die,’ lets them save the day against high stakes, and lets them see how general and investigative skills work. Just be sure to split up the tasks between different PCs, and have only 1-2 PCs on any given task. Ignore all extraneous rules and skills and only focus on the relevant ones. Don’t explain any rule until it actually becomes necessary in the demo.

128915.name: Paradox (fan expansion for Dominion)
128915.description:
Paradox is a fan expansion for Dominion.

Wait, all of a sudden playing this card might help my opponent more? But yet, if they choose to let it help them, it will push me over the top to get an early Province lead. While not all cards involve decisions quite this Paradoxical, it was the driving inspiration for this Chapter to the Dominion Fan Universe. Consider printing this fan expansion if you are interested in:
A) heightened player interaction;
B) more variety in win conditions;
C) additional powerful card combinations depending on setup;
D) shifted timing, with once strong early game cards becoming strong only late game (in certain setups);
E) non-obvious cards which involve more critical thinking than “do I have any actions left” to play;
F) and just generally re-thinking how best to play.

New mechanics (and further exploration of existing mechanics) to accomplish this include:
Curses – A greater variety of curse cards, some of which you’ll actually want (in controlled quantities).
Loops – Sustain a card ability as long as you can meet the trigger.
Vulnerability – A new type of interaction with other players and increased occurrence of Attack – Reaction plays.
Guilds and Variant Rules – New goals to aim for to mix up the rather abstract strive for victory point cards.
Reaction cards – A higher saturation than normal of reaction cards that respond to more than just attack cards. Some you may choose to reveal only at the right times they are triggered rather than at every opportunity. And others are simply beneficial to all, in a somewhat reverse attack fashion.

_________________________________________________________________
Components:
Total Expansion Size (with all options)
587 cards – 36 mats – 46 tokens – 1 rules document

Kingdom cards – 404 cards (40 decks: 38 decks of 10 cards, + 2 Victory card decks of 12 cards)

Other cards / components: optional (breakdown in rules)

128916.name: Some Kid's Parents
128916.description:
From the front cover:
Some Kid's Parents
A One-Round Shadowrun 3rd ed. Virtual Seattle Adventure
